longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: To promote education in Hong Kong, and to consolidate and amend the law relating to the supervision and control of schools and the teaching therein, and for purposes connected therewith.

editorialNote.content: For the saving and transitional provisions relating to the amendments made by the Education Reorganization (Miscellaneous Amendments) Ordinance 2003 (3 of 2003), see Part 3 of that Ordinance.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title
section.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Education Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Application
section.leadIn: This Ordinance shall not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the University of Hong Kong established by the University of Hong Kong Ordinance (Cap. 1053);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: The Chinese University of Hong Kong established by The Chinese University of Hong Kong Ordinance (Cap. 1109);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: The Hong Kong Polytechnic University established by The Hong Kong Polytechnic University Ordinance (Cap. 1075); (Amended 6 of 1982 s. 24; 94 of 1994 s. 24; E.R. 1 of 2021)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any post secondary college registered under the Post Secondary Colleges Ordinance (Cap. 320);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any technical college or technical institute defined in section 2 of the Vocational Training Council Ordinance (Cap. 1130); (Added 6 of 1982 s. 24. Amended 50 of 1983 s. 34; 35 of 1991 s. 14)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any industrial training centre or skills centre defined in section 2 of the Vocational Training Council Ordinance (Cap. 1130); (Added 6 of 1982 s. 24. Amended 35 of 1991 s. 14)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the Hong Kong Baptist University established by the Hong Kong Baptist University Ordinance (Cap. 1126); (Added 50 of 1983 s. 34. Amended 38 of 1984 s. 28; 93 of 1994 s. 40)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the City University of Hong Kong established by the City University of Hong Kong Ordinance (Cap. 1132); (Added 65 of 1983 s. 25. Amended 38 of 1984 s. 28; 47 of 1987 s. 25; 92 of 1994 s. 33)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: The Hong Kong Academy for Performing Arts established by The Hong Kong Academy for Performing Arts Ordinance (Cap. 1135); (Added 38 of 1984 s. 28. Amended 47 of 1987 s. 25; 72 of 1992 s. 28)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology established by The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology Ordinance (Cap. 1141); (Added 47 of 1987 s. 25)

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: the Hong Kong Metropolitan University established by the Hong Kong Metropolitan University Ordinance (Cap. 1145); (Replaced 50 of 1997 s. 29. Amended 22 of 2021 s. 2)

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: Lingnan University established by the Lingnan University Ordinance (Cap. 1165); or (Replaced 54 of 1999 s. 31)

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: The Education University of Hong Kong established by The Education University of Hong Kong Ordinance (Cap. 444). (Added 16 of 1994 s. 26. Amended 6 of 2016 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires— (Amended 27 of 2004 s. 2)
subsection.def: aided school (資助學校) means any school that receives subsidies from the Government in accordance with the code of aid for primary schools, the code of aid for secondary schools or the code of aid for special schools; (Added 21 of 2000 s. 2)
Appeal Board (上訴委員會) means an Appeal Board appointed under section 62(1)(aa); (Added 1 of 2004 s. 2)
Appeal Boards Panel (上訴委員團) means the Appeal Boards Panel appointed under section 59(1)(a); (Added 1 of 2004 s. 2)
authorized person (獲授權人士) has the same meaning as it has in section 2 of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123); (Replaced 47 of 1990 s. 2)
Building Authority (建築事務監督) has the same meaning as it has in section 2 of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123);

certificate of provisional registration (臨時註冊證明書) means in relation to a school which is provisionally registered, the certificate which is issued by the Permanent Secretary under section 18(1) in respect of the school; (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 2)

def.name: CertificateOfRegistration
def.leadIn: certificate of registration (註冊證明書) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a school which is registered under section 13, the certificate issued by the Permanent Secretary under section 18(1) in respect of the school; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a school which is registered under either of the repealed Ordinances, the certificate of registration issued by the Permanent Secretary under such Ordinance in respect of the school; (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 2)

subsection.def: code of aid for primary schools (小學資助則例) means the code described as such and issued by the Permanent Secretary, under the terms of which the Government gives subsidies to certain primary schools, as the same may be amended from time to time; (Added 21 of 2000 s. 2. Amended 3 of 2003 s. 2)

code of aid for secondary schools (中學資助則例) means the code described as such and issued by the Permanent Secretary, under the terms of which the Government gives subsidies to certain secondary schools, as the same may be amended from time to time; (Added 21 of 2000 s. 2. Amended 3 of 2003 s. 2)

code of aid for special schools (特殊學校資助則例) means the code described as such and issued by the Permanent Secretary, under the terms of which the Government gives subsidies to certain special schools, practical schools or skills opportunity schools, as the same may be amended from time to time; (Added 21 of 2000 s. 2. Amended 3 of 2003 s. 2)

document (文件) includes any account, counterfoil, text-book, exercise book, pamphlet, publication, newspaper, poster, drawing, sketch, film, filmstrip, slide, gramophone record, and other printed, written or recorded matter, whether relating to school management, teaching or recreation or to any other activity of or in connexion with a school;

DSS school (直資學校) means a school which has joined the Direct Subsidy Scheme administered by the Permanent Secretary under which the school receives subsidy directly from the Government on such terms and conditions as specified by the Government from time to time; (Added 1 of 2004 s. 2)
evening instruction (夜間授課) means any instruction the greater part of which in any one day takes place after 6 p.m.;
functions (職能) includes powers and duties;
IMC school (設有法團校董會學校) means a school in respect of which an incorporated management committee is established under Part IIIB; (Added 27 of 2004 s. 2)
inclusive fee (費用總額) means the total sum of money charged in respect of the education of a pupil in a school;

incorporated management committee (法團校董會), in relation to a school, means the incorporated management committee established under section 40BN or 40BX in respect of the school; (Added 27 of 2004 s. 2)
inspector of schools (學校督學) means a person who is appointed under section 79 to be an inspector of schools, a medical officer of schools and a health inspector of schools;
kindergarten education (幼稚園教育) means a 2 years course of education normally commencing when a child has attained the age of 4 years; (Replaced 42 of 1993 s. 2)
manage (管理) includes administer;

def.name: ManagementAuthority
def.leadIn: management authority (管理當局) means, in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a school without IMC, the supervisor of the school;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an IMC school, the incorporated management committee of the school; (Added 27 of 2004 s. 2)

subsection.def: management committee (校董會), in relation to a school without IMC, means the managers of the school; (Replaced 27 of 2004 s. 2)

def.name: Manager
def.leadIn: manager (校董), in relation to a school—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: subject to sections 40AL and 40AS, includes an alternate manager within the meaning of section 40AB; (Replaced 27 of 2004 s. 2)

subsection.def: nursery education (幼兒教育) means a one year course of education normally commencing when a child has attained the age of 3 years; (Replaced 42 of 1993 s. 2)
Permanent Secretary (常任秘書長) means the Permanent Secretary for Education; (Added 3 of 2003 s. 2. Amended L.N. 130 of 2007)
permit to teach (准用教員許可證) means a permit issued under section 50(1) or under either of the repealed Ordinances for the employment as a teacher in a school of a person who is not a registered teacher;
permitted teacher (准用教員) means a person, not being a registered teacher, who is permitted to be employed as a teacher in a school in accordance with a permit to teach;
post secondary education (專上教育) means education which is beyond the stage of secondary education;

practical school (實用中學) means a school that provides education for pupils through a practical curriculum and that has been approved by the Permanent Secretary for such purpose; (Added 21 of 2000 s. 2. Amended 3 of 2003 s. 2)
primary education (小學教育) means a 6 years course of education normally commencing when a child has attained the age of 6 years; (Replaced 42 of 1993 s. 2)
primary school (小學) means a school which provides primary education; (Added 34 of 1979 s. 2)

principal (校長) means, subject to section 58AA, a teacher who is approved as the principal of a school under section 53(2) or section 57(2) or under either of the repealed Ordinances; (Amended 8 of 2001 s. 2)
proof of identity (身分證明文件) has the meaning assigned to it by section 17B(1) of the Immigration Ordinance (Cap. 115); (Added 8 of 2001 s. 2)
provisionally registered (臨時註冊) means provisionally registered under section 15;
registered (註冊), in relation to a school, means registered under section 13 or under either of the repealed Ordinances;
registered name (註冊名稱) means the name in which a school is registered or provisionally registered;
registered teacher (檢定教員) means a person who is registered as a teacher under section 45(1) or under either of the repealed Ordinances;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Education Ordinance 1952 (Cap. 279, 1964 Ed.); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Education Ordinance 1913 (26 of 1913);

subsection.def: school (學校) means an institution, organization or establishment which provides for 20 or more persons during any one day or 8 or more persons at any one time, any nursery, kindergarten, primary, secondary or post secondary education or any other educational course by any means, including correspondence delivered by hand or through the postal services; (Amended 38 of 1983 s. 2; 42 of 1993 s. 2)
school management company (學校管理公司), in relation to a school, means a company designated as such under subsection (2); (Added 27 of 2004 s. 2)
school premises (校舍) includes school recreation rooms, residential facilities, playing fields and playing grounds, and any other places used for the purposes of a school;
school without IMC (不設法團校董會學校) means a school other than an IMC school; (Added 27 of 2004 s. 2)

secondary education (中學教育) means a course of education after primary education which normally commences when a child has attained the age of 12 years and is completed before he attains the age of 19 years; (Replaced 42 of 1993 s. 2)
secondary school (中學) means a school which provides secondary education; (Added 34 of 1979 s. 2)

skills opportunity school (技能訓練學校) means a school that provides education for pupils through a skills oriented curriculum and that has been approved by the Permanent Secretary for such purpose; (Added 21 of 2000 s. 2. Amended 3 of 2003 s. 2)

special school (特殊學校) means a school that provides education for pupils through a special education curriculum and that has been approved by the Permanent Secretary for such purpose; (Added 21 of 2000 s. 2. Amended 3 of 2003 s. 2)
specified form (指明格式) means a form specified by the Permanent Secretary; (Added 8 of 2001 s. 2. Amended 3 of 2003 s. 2)

sponsoring body (辦學團體), in relation to a school, means a society, organization or body (whether incorporated or not) which is approved in writing by the Permanent Secretary to be the sponsoring body of the school; (Replaced 27 of 2004 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a school without IMC, a manager who is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: approved as the supervisor of the school under section 34 or 38(2) or under either of the repealed Ordinances; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: approved as the acting supervisor of the school under section 38A(2);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to an IMC school, a manager who is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: appointed or elected under section 40AJ(2) as the supervisor of the school; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: appointed or elected under section 40AJ(3) as the acting supervisor of the school. (Amended 27 of 2004 s. 2)

subsection.content: The Permanent Secretary may by notice published in the Gazette designate any company which is incorporated under the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622), or under the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 32) as in force at the time of the incorporation, for the purposes of operating a school as stated in its articles of association as a school management company. (Added 27 of 2004 s. 2. Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)
A notice published under subsection (2) is not subsidiary legislation. (Added 27 of 2004 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: The Permanent Secretary may authorize any officer of the Education Bureau— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 3; L.N. 130 of 2007)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to exercise any function of the Permanent Secretary under any provision of this Ordinance other than section 9(5); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at the directorate rank to exercise any function of the Permanent Secretary under section 9(5). (Amended 8 of 2001 s. 3; 3 of 2003 s. 3)

section.name: s6
section.heading: Power of Chief Executive to give directions

subsection.content: The Chief Executive may give to the Permanent Secretary and to any other public officer, other than a judge, a district judge, or a magistrate, such directions as he thinks fit with respect to the exercise or performance of their respective functions under this Ordinance, either generally or in any particular case. (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)
A person to whom a direction is given by the Chief Executive under subsection (1) shall, in the exercise or performance of his functions under this Ordinance, comply with that direction.

subsection.leadIn: The Permanent Secretary shall maintain— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a register of schools, in which shall be entered—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the name of every registered school; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the premises which are specified in the certificate of registration of the school;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a register of schools which are provisionally registered, in which shall be entered—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the name of every school which is provisionally registered; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the premises which are specified in the certificate of provisional registration of the school;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: a register of managers, in which shall be entered—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the name and address of every manager; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the registered name and the address of every school of which a person is a manager; (Amended 27 of 2004 ss. 3 & 72)

paragraph.name: da
paragraph.leadIn: a register of incorporated management committees, in which shall be entered—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the name of every incorporated management committee; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in respect of each incorporated management committee, the name and tenure of office of each manager and the category of manager specified in section 40AL(2) to which he belongs; and (Added 27 of 2004 s. 3)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a register of teachers, in which shall be entered the name of every registered teacher.

subsection.content: Such other particulars as the Permanent Secretary considers necessary may be entered in any register or list referred to in subsection (1). (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

subsection.leadIn: The entries referred to in subsection (1)(da)(i) and (ii) shall be made available in such manner as the Permanent Secretary thinks fit for public inspection to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enable any member of the public to ascertain whether he is dealing with a manager; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ensure transparency and accountability of the incorporated management committee. (Added 27 of 2004 s. 3)

def.name: InterestedPersons
def.leadIn: In this section, interested persons (利害關係人) means, in relation to a school— (Amended E.R. 1 of 2021)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the owners of the school;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the managers of the school;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the teachers of the school;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: persons who are not owners, managers or teachers of the school but manage or take part in the management of the school; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the students of the school. (Added 27 of 2004 s. 4)

subsection.leadIn: The following schools and the interested persons of such schools shall be exempt from this Ordinance— (Amended 27 of 2004 s. 4)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any school entirely maintained and controlled by the Government;

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: any school which solely provides regulated courses within the meaning of the Non-local Higher and Professional Education (Regulation) Ordinance (Cap. 493); (Added 50 of 1996 s. 43)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any school which provides education which is solely religious; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any school which has been exempted from either of the repealed Ordinances by notification in the Gazette and the exemption of which has not been withdrawn.

subsection.content: The Chief Executive in Council may, by order published in the Gazette, withdraw wholly or partly the exemption conferred by subsection (1) on any school and the interested persons of the school. (Amended 55 of 2000 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may, by order published in the Gazette, exempt from all or any of the provisions of this Ordinance— (Amended 55 of 2000 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any school or class or description of school; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the interested persons of such school or class or description of school,

subsection.continued: on such conditions, if any, as he thinks fit.

subsection.content: An order under subsection (3) exempting a school from section 10 shall not preclude the making of an application for registration of the school or the registration or provisional registration of the school, and if the school is registered or provisionally registered the exemption shall cease to have effect.

subsection.leadIn: The Permanent Secretary may, by order in writing, exempt from all or any of the provisions of this Ordinance— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any school which provides education consisting only of a series of lectures, or a course of instruction in a particular subject or topic;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any school which provides less than 10 hours of academic instruction each week; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the interested persons of any school referred to in paragraph (a) or (b),

subsection.continued: on such conditions, if any, as he thinks fit.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Registration and Provisional Registration of Schools

section.name: s10
section.heading: Schools to be registered or provisionally registered

subsection.content: Every school shall be registered or provisionally registered.

If an aided school or a DSS school provides evening instruction in addition to other education, there shall be deemed to be a separate school in respect of the evening instruction and such separate school shall also be registered or provisionally registered. (Amended 1 of 2004 s. 3)

section.name: s11
section.heading: Application for registration of school
section.leadIn: An application for registration of a school shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made to the Permanent Secretary in the specified form; and (Amended 42 of 1993 s. 6; 8 of 2001 s. 4; 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: accompanied—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by the documents specified in such form; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the school is to be operated in or in any part of any premises which are not designed and constructed for the purposes of a school, by the additional documents specified in section 12(1).

section.name: s12
section.heading: Additional documents required where premises not designed and constructed as a school

subsection.leadIn: The documents referred to in section 11(b)(ii) shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a certificate from the competent authority as to his opinion with regard to the suitability for the purposes of a school of the premises or the part of the premises in which the school is to be operated, having regard to the loading for which they are designed and constructed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a certificate from the competent authority that the premises in or in part of which the school is to be operated do not have structural timber floors;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a certificate from the Director of Fire Services that the use for the purposes of a school of the premises or the part of the premises in which the school is to be operated would not expose the persons in the school premises to any undue risk of fire; (Replaced 6 of 1985 s. 2)

paragraph.name: ca
paragraph.content: a certificate from the competent authority that in the event of fire in the premises in or in part of which the school is to be operated the means of escape for all persons in the premises (including the persons in the school premises) would be adequate; (Added 6 of 1985 s. 2. Amended 47 of 1990 s. 4)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123) applies to the premises in or in part of which the school is to be operated, a notice in writing from the Building Authority stating that he does not intend, in exercise of the powers conferred on him by section 25 of that Ordinance, to prohibit the use for the purposes of a school of the premises or the part of the premises in which the school is to be operated; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the competent authority has certified under paragraph (a) that in his opinion the premises or the part of the premises in which the school is to be operated are not suitable for the purposes of a school, having regard to the loading for which they are designed and constructed;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the premises in or in part of which the school is to be operated were erected prior to 1 January 1946; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: at the time of erection of the premises in or in part of which the school is to be operated, the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123) did not apply to such premises,

paragraph.continued: a certificate from an authorized person that the premises in or in part of which the school is to be operated are in sound structural condition. (Amended 47 of 1990 s. 4)

subsection.leadIn: An application to the competent authority, the Building Authority or the Director of Fire Services for a certificate or a notice required for the purposes of subsection (1) shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made in such form as the Permanent Secretary shall specify; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by a plan, drawn to such scale and with such number of copies as the Permanent Secretary shall specify, of the premises or the part of the premises in which the school is to be operated. (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

subsection.content: The Director of Buildings may, where he is the competent authority for the purposes of subsection (1)(a), (b) and (ca), appoint any officer of the Buildings Department to perform the functions of the competent authority under those paragraphs. (Amended L.N. 76 of 1982; L.N. 94 of 1986; 47 of 1990 s. 4; L.N. 291 of 1993)
Nothing in this section shall affect the powers of the Building Authority under the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123).

def.name: CompetentAuthority
def.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, competent authority (主管當局) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Housing Authority in the case of any premises or part of any premises upon land vested in the Housing Authority or over which the Housing Authority has control and management; (Replaced 23 of 1973 s. 36)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in any other case, the Director of Buildings and any officer of the Buildings Department appointed by him under subsection (3). (Amended L.N. 76 of 1982; L.N. 94 of 1986; L.N. 291 of 1993)

section.name: s13
section.heading: Registration of school
section.leadIn: On receiving an application in accordance with section 11, the Permanent Secretary shall make such inquiry as he considers necessary and shall determine the application— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by registering the school in respect of which the application is made; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by refusing under section 14 to register the school.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Grounds for refusal to register school

subsection.leadIn: The Permanent Secretary may refuse to register a school if it appears to him— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the proposed school premises are or are likely to be for any reason unsuitable for use for the purposes of a school;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that any provision of this Ordinance is being or will be contravened in respect of the school;

paragraph.name: d
g
paragraph.content: that the equipment which is to be used by the school will not allow of satisfactory tuition in the subjects to be taught by the school; (Amended 42 of 1993 s. 7)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: that the composition of the proposed management committee or incorporated management committee (as may be appropriate) is such that the school is not likely to be managed satisfactorily, or is such that the education of the pupils is not likely to be promoted in a proper manner; (Amended 42 of 1993 s. 7; 27 of 2004 s. 5)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: that the composition of the proposed management committee or incorporated management committee (as may be appropriate) or of the proposed teaching staff is the same or substantially the same as that of a school which the Permanent Secretary has previously refused to register, or the registration or provisional registration of which the Permanent Secretary has previously cancelled; (Amended 27 of 2004 s. 5)

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.leadIn: that he has previously—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: refused to register the school; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: cancelled the registration or provisional registration of the school;

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.leadIn: that any part of the proposed school premises—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: was to have been used for the purposes of a school which the Permanent Secretary has previously refused to register; or

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: that in or in connexion with the application for registration any statement has been made or information has been furnished which is false in any material particular or by reason of the omission of any material particular; (Amended 42 of 1993 s. 7)

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.leadIn: that the proposed registered name of the school is unsuitable, or is the same as or similar to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the name in which another school is registered; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the name of any school the registration of which has been cancelled; or (Amended 42 of 1993 s. 7)

paragraph.name: p
paragraph.content: that the content of the course to be offered is not of a satisfactory standard. (Added 42 of 1993 s. 7)

subsection.content: The Permanent Secretary may also refuse to register a school if he refuses under section 35(1) to approve as the first supervisor of the school the person who is recommended to be the supervisor by the applicant for registration of the school.

At any time after an application for registration of a school is made in accordance with section 11 and before the application is determined, the Permanent Secretary may provisionally register the school for such period, not exceeding 12 months, as he thinks fit.
The Permanent Secretary may extend the period of provisional registration of a school for such further periods, not exceeding 12 months at one time, as he thinks fit.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Effect on provisional registration when application for registration is determined

subsection.content: If the Permanent Secretary registers a school which is provisionally registered, the provisional registration of the school shall cease to have effect.
If the Permanent Secretary refuses to register a school which is provisionally registered, the provisional registration of the school shall not by reason only of such refusal cease to have effect.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Restrictions on registration and provisional registration
section.leadIn: Notwithstanding sections 13 and 15, the Permanent Secretary shall not— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: register or provisionally register a school in any name containing the word “university” or the Chinese characters “ 大學 ” or “ 學院 ”. (Amended E.R. 1 of 2021)

section.name: s18
section.heading: Certificate of registration or provisional registration

subsection.content: On registering or provisionally registering a school, the Permanent Secretary shall issue to the management authority a certificate of registration or a certificate of provisional registration in the specified form and sufficient copies of the certificate so that the certificate or a copy may be exhibited in each of the premises specified in the certificate. (Amended 8 of 2001 s. 4)

Except as provided in subsection (3), section 20 and section 71, the management authority of a school shall cause the certificate or a copy issued by the Permanent Secretary under subsection (1) to be exhibited at all times in a conspicuous place in each of the premises specified in the certificate.

If the Permanent Secretary extends the period of provisional registration of a school under section 15(2), the management authority shall within one month after the date when it is notified of the extension deliver the certificate of provisional registration and every copy of the certificate to the Permanent Secretary, who shall amend the certificate and the copies thereof accordingly and return them to the management authority. (Amended 27 of 2004 s. 6)

section.name: s18A
section.heading: Approval of Permanent Secretary required for post secondary education

subsection.content: No management authority of a school shall cause or allow post secondary education to be provided at the school unless it has received the approval of the Permanent Secretary to do so. (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11; 27 of 2004 s. 70)

The supervisor of a school without IMC who contravenes subsection (1) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 3 months. (Amended L.N. 205 of 2000)

If an incorporated management committee contravenes subsection (1) with the consent or connivance of a manager of the school, the manager shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 3 months. (Added 27 of 2004 s. 7)

section.name: s19
section.heading: Premises in which school may be operated

subsection.content: No school shall be operated in any premises other than the premises specified in the certificate of registration or provisional registration of the school.
No teacher in any school shall teach in any premises other than the premises specified in the certificate of registration or provisional registration of the school.

subsection.leadIn: The management authority of a school may apply in writing to the Permanent Secretary to amend the certificate of registration or provisional registration by— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11; 27 of 2004 s. 70)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specifying in the certificate any additional or alternative premises; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: deleting from the certificate reference to any premises or to any part of any premises.

subsection.leadIn: An application under subsection (1) shall be accompanied by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the certificate in respect of which the application is made;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: every copy of the certificate issued under section 18(1); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: 3 copies of a plan or diagram, specifying dimensions, of the premises or the part of the premises to which the application relates.

subsection.content: An application under subsection (1)(a) shall specify the names and addresses of the landlord and the tenant of the premises or the part of the premises to which the application relates.

An application under subsection (1)(a) in respect of any premises or any part of any premises which are not designed and constructed for the purposes of a school shall be accompanied by the certificates and the notice specified in section 12(1), and the provisions of section 12(2), (3), (4) and (5) shall apply as if the application were an application for registration of a school.

subsection.leadIn: On receiving an application in accordance with this section, the Permanent Secretary shall make such inquiry as he considers necessary and shall determine the application— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by granting the application wholly or partly, in either of which cases he shall amend the certificate of registration or provisional registration and the copies thereof accordingly; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by refusing to grant the application.

subsection.content: The Permanent Secretary shall return to the management authority the certificate of registration or provisional registration and the copies thereof, amended accordingly if he grants an application under subsection (5)(a). (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11; 27 of 2004 s. 70)
Where a school that is registered or provisionally registered wishes to change its name it shall first obtain the approval of the Permanent Secretary.
In considering an application under this section the same criteria apply as in a decision by the Permanent Secretary under section 14(1)(o).

section.name: s21
section.heading: Changes in design or use of premises increasing fire risk

subsection.leadIn: If in the opinion of the Director of Fire Services a change in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the design or structure of the premises in or in any part of which a school is operated; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the use of any part of the premises in or in any part of which a school is operated,

subsection.continued: is such that the persons in the school premises are exposed to any undue risk of fire, he may deliver to the Permanent Secretary a notice in writing which shall either— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 6)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: specify any provision which in his opinion should be made by the school to eliminate the undue risk of fire; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: if the Director of Fire Services considers that no provision can be made by the school to eliminate the undue risk of fire, state that in his opinion no such provision can be made. (Replaced 6 of 1985 s. 3)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: If in the opinion of the Building Authority a change in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the design or structure of the premises in or in any part of which a school is operated; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the use of any part of the premises in or in any part of which a school is operated,

subsection.continued: is such that in the event of fire in the premises in or in any part of which the school is operated the means of escape for all the persons in the premises (including the persons in the school premises) would not be adequate, he may deliver to the Permanent Secretary a notice in writing which shall either— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 6)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: specify any provision which in his opinion should be made by the school to ensure that in the event of fire the means of escape for all the persons in the premises (including the persons in the school premises) will be adequate; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: if the Building Authority considers that no provision can be made by the school to ensure that in the event of fire the means of escape for all the persons in the premises (including the persons in the school premises) will be adequate, state that in his opinion no such provision can be made. (Added 6 of 1985 s. 3)

subsection.content: If the Director of Fire Services delivers to the Permanent Secretary a notice under subsection (1) in respect of a school specifying any provision which the Director of Fire Services considers should be made by the school, the Permanent Secretary may by notice in writing served on the management authority of the school require such provision to be made. (Amended 27 of 2004 s. 70)

If the Building Authority delivers to the Permanent Secretary a notice under subsection (1A) in respect of a school specifying any provision which the Building Authority considers should be made by the school, the Permanent Secretary may by notice in writing served on the management authority of the school require such provision to be made. (Added 6 of 1985 s. 3. Amended 27 of 2004 s. 70)

section.name: s22
section.heading: Grounds for cancellation of registration or provisional registration of school

subsection.leadIn: The Permanent Secretary may cancel the registration or provisional registration of a school— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 7)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on any ground specified in section 14(1)(b), (c), (d), (g), (i), (j), (k), (l), (n) or (p) on which he would have been entitled to refuse registration of a school, whether or not such ground existed at the time when the school was registered or provisionally registered; (Amended 42 of 1993 s. 11)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if any manager of the school has committed an offence against this Ordinance subsequent to the registration or provisional registration of the school;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if it appears to the Permanent Secretary that the school has ceased to exist, or that for a continuous period of not less than one school term the school has ceased to operate;

paragraph.name: ca
paragraph.leadIn: upon the written application of the supervisor, if the registration or provisional registration of the school, not being an aided school or a DSS school, was effected—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: before the commencement* of section 3 of the Education (Miscellaneous Amendments) Ordinance 2004 (1 of 2004); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: under section 10(2) in respect of evening instruction; (Added 1 of 2004 s. 4)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if a direction given in a notice served under section 82(2) has not been complied with; (Amended 27 of 2004 s. 8)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: if it appears to the Permanent Secretary that the school is not being managed satisfactorily, or that the education of the pupils is not being promoted in a proper manner; (Amended 27 of 2004 s. 8)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: if, in the case of a school which is operated in or in any part of any premises which, in the opinion of the competent authority for the purposes of section 12, are unsuitable for use for the purposes of a school having regard to the loading for which the premises or the part of the premises are designed and constructed, the Permanent Secretary has received a report from an authorized architect that the premises in or in part of which the school is operated are not in sound structural condition;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: if in respect of the school any provision specified in a notice under section 21(2) or (3) has not been made— (Amended 6 of 1985 s. 4)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: within 2 months of the date of service of the notice; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: before the commencement of the school term next following the date of service of the notice,

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: if, under section 21(1), the Permanent Secretary has received a notice from the Director of Fire Services stating that, in the latter’s opinion, no provision can be made by the school to eliminate any undue risk of fire; (Replaced 6 of 1985 s. 4)

paragraph.name: ha
paragraph.content: if, under section 21(1A), the Permanent Secretary has received a notice from the Building Authority stating that, in the latter’s opinion, no provision can be made by the school to ensure that in the event of fire in the premises in or in any part of which the school is operated the means of escape for all the persons in the premises (including the persons in the school premises) will be adequate; (Added 6 of 1985 s. 4)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: if the school is operated in any name other than the name in which it is registered or provisionally registered; or

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: if it appears to the Permanent Secretary that any provision of this Ordinance is being or has been contravened in respect of the school. (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 7)

subsection.leadIn: The Permanent Secretary shall cancel the registration or provisional registration of a school if— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 7)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registration of every manager of the school is cancelled; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no manager of the school is permitted under section 66 to continue to act as a manager of the school.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Managers of schools to be registered
section.content: No person shall act as a manager of a school unless he is registered as a manager of the school under section 29(1).

section.name: s28
section.heading: Application for registration of manager
section.content: An application for registration as a manager of a school shall be made to the Permanent Secretary in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: On receiving an application in accordance with section 28, the Permanent Secretary shall make such inquiry as he considers necessary and shall determine the application— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by registering the applicant as a manager of the school in respect of which the application is made; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by refusing under section 30 to register the applicant as a manager of the school in respect of which the application is made.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Grounds for refusal to register manager

subsection.leadIn: The Permanent Secretary may refuse to register an applicant as a manager of a school if it appears to the Permanent Secretary that— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant is not resident in Hong Kong for at least 9 months in each year;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant is not a fit and proper person to be a manager;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the applicant is a person in respect of whom a permit to teach has previously been cancelled;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: in making or in connection with any application—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for registration of a school;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for registration as a manager or a teacher; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: to employ a person as a permitted teacher in a school,

paragraph.continued: the applicant has made any statement or furnished any information which is false in any material particular or by reason of the omission of any material particular.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: The Permanent Secretary may refuse to register an applicant as a manager of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a school if the applicant—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is a bankrupt within the meaning of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6) or has entered into a voluntary arrangement under that Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has previously been convicted in Hong Kong or elsewhere of a criminal offence punishable with imprisonment;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a school if the applicant is under the age of 18 years;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a school if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the applicant has attained the age of 70 years and he fails to produce a medical certificate issued by a registered medical practitioner within 2 months before the date of his application certifying that the applicant is physically fit to perform the functions of a manager; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the applicant is under the age of 70 years and he fails to produce, upon a request by the Permanent Secretary, a medical certificate issued by a registered medical practitioner after the date of such request certifying that the applicant is physically fit to perform the functions of a manager; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an IMC school or a school in respect of which a submission has been made under section 40BK or 40BU if the applicant has been registered as a manager of 5 or more schools. (Added 27 of 2004 s. 11)

subsection.leadIn: The Permanent Secretary shall refuse to register an applicant as a manager of— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11; 27 of 2004 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a school without IMC if it appears to the Permanent Secretary that the applicant is not acceptable as a manager of the school to the majority of the managers; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an IMC school if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the applicant is on a list of proposed managers which the Permanent Secretary refuses to approve under section 40BM or 40BW; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: subject to any exemption granted under section 40AR, the registration of the applicant as a manager of the school will render the composition of the incorporated management committee of the school inconsistent with the constitution of the committee.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Grounds for cancellation of registration of manager

subsection.leadIn: The Permanent Secretary may cancel the registration of a manager of a school— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the person has been an office-bearer, as defined in section 2 of the Societies Ordinance (Cap. 151), of any society or a branch which has had its registration or exemption from registration cancelled under section 5D, or its operation or continued operation prohibited by the Secretary for Security under section 8 of that Ordinance; (Amended 118 of 1997 s. 21)

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: if the Secretary for Security has made an order under section 60(1) or (2) of the Safeguarding National Security Ordinance (6 of 2024) in relation to an organization (as defined by section 58 of that Ordinance), and the person was an office-bearer (as defined by section 58 of that Ordinance) of the organization immediately before the order was made; (Added 6 of 2024 s. 154)

paragraph.name: ac
paragraph.content: if the Chief Executive in Council has made an order under section 360C or 360N of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) in relation to a company or non-Hong Kong company (as defined by section 2(1) of that Ordinance), and the person was a director (as defined by section 2(1) of that Ordinance) of the company immediately before the order was made; (Added 6 of 2024 s. 154)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on any ground specified in section 30(1) or (1A) which applies to the manager, whether or not such ground existed at the time when he was registered as a manager of the school; (Amended 27 of 2004 s. 12)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if it appears to the Permanent Secretary that the person— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has ceased to be a manager;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: cannot perform satisfactorily or is not performing satisfactorily the duties of a manager;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the person has contravened any provision of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: if it appears to the Permanent Secretary that— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any school of which the person is registered as a manager is not being managed satisfactorily;

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: any pupil of a school of which the person is registered as a manager is not under proper supervision or control while on the school premises; (Amended 27 of 2004 s. 12)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: (where the school is an IMC school) if the Permanent Secretary receives a notice in writing from the incorporated management committee of the school that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the manager has been absent without the consent of the committee from all meetings of the committee in a school year; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the manager has been given due notice to attend those meetings; (Added 27 of 2004 s. 12)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: if the manager fails to produce, upon request by the Permanent Secretary, a medical certificate issued by a registered medical practitioner after the date of such request certifying that the manager is physically fit to perform the functions of a manager; (Added 27 of 2004 s. 12)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: if he receives a notice under section 40AX as regards the manager; or (Added 27 of 2004 s. 12)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: if the manager contravenes section 40BF. (Added 27 of 2004 s. 12)

subsection.leadIn: The Permanent Secretary shall cancel the registration of a manager of a school— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: if he receives a notice under section 39(2)(a) or 40AK(1)(b)(i) in respect of the manager; (Added 27 of 2004 s. 12)

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: if he receives a notice under section 40AW as regards the manager; or (Added 27 of 2004 s. 12)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at the written request of the manager.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: The Permanent Secretary shall cancel the registration of a manager of a school without IMC if it appears to him that the manager is no longer acceptable as a manager of the school to the majority of the managers of the school. (Added 27 of 2004 s. 12)

part.name: P3A
part.heading: Management of Schools without Incorporated Management Committee

section.name: s31A
section.heading: Application of Part IIIA
section.content: This Part applies to a school without IMC.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Management committee to manage school
section.content: Every school shall be managed by its management committee.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Responsibilities of management committee
section.leadIn: The management committee of a school shall be responsible for ensuring—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the school is managed satisfactorily;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the education of the pupils is promoted in a proper manner; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that this Ordinance is complied with.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Approval of first supervisor of school
section.content: Subject to section 35, the Permanent Secretary shall approve as the first supervisor of a school the person who is recommended to be the supervisor by the applicant for registration of the school.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Grounds for refusal to approve supervisor

subsection.content: The Permanent Secretary may refuse to approve a person as the supervisor of a school if the Permanent Secretary is not satisfied that the person is a fit and proper person to be the supervisor.
The Permanent Secretary shall not approve a person as the supervisor of a school unless the person is a manager of the school. (Amended 27 of 2004 s. 72)

section.name: s36
section.heading: Tenure of office of supervisor
section.leadIn: The supervisor of a school shall hold office until—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he ceases to be a manager of the school; (Amended 27 of 2004 s. 72)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he resigns;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Permanent Secretary withdraws his approval of the supervisor under section 37; or (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Permanent Secretary approves another manager of the school as the supervisor under section 38(2). (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11; 27 of 2004 s. 72)

section.name: s37
section.heading: Grounds for withdrawal of approval of supervisor
section.leadIn: The Permanent Secretary may withdraw his approval of the supervisor of a school if it appears to the Permanent Secretary that the supervisor— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is no longer a fit and proper person to be the supervisor;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not performing the duties of the supervisor satisfactorily;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has ceased to perform the duties of the supervisor; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is no longer acceptable as such to the majority of the management committee.

subsection.leadIn: If in the case of any school which is registered or provisionally registered—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Permanent Secretary refuses under section 35 to approve a person who has been recommended to be the supervisor;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the supervisor ceases under section 36 to hold office;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: there is for any other reason no supervisor;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the supervisor ceases to perform the duties of the supervisor; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the supervisor is no longer acceptable as such to the majority of the management committee,

subsection.continued: the management committee shall within one month recommend for the approval of the Permanent Secretary another manager of the school to be the supervisor. (Amended L.N. 95 of 1993)

subsection.content: Subject to section 35, the Permanent Secretary shall approve as the supervisor of the school the manager who is recommended under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: If the supervisor of any school is or is likely to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: absent from Hong Kong for a period of not less than 28 days; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: unable by reason of his illness to carry out his duties for a period of not less than 28 days,

subsection.continued: the management committee shall recommend for the approval of the Permanent Secretary another manager of the school to act as supervisor during the supervisor’s absence or inability to carry out his duties. (Amended L.N. 95 of 1993; 27 of 2004 s. 72)

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), the Permanent Secretary shall approve as the acting supervisor of the school the manager who is recommended under subsection (1). (Amended 27 of 2004 s. 72)

The Permanent Secretary may refuse to approve a person as the acting supervisor of a school if the Permanent Secretary is not satisfied that the person is a fit and proper person to be the acting supervisor.
Without prejudice to subsection (5), the approval under subsection (2) shall be for such period as the Permanent Secretary may therein specify.
The Permanent Secretary may at any time and for any reason withdraw his approval under subsection (2).
Section 39 shall apply in relation to an acting supervisor approved under subsection (2) as it applies to a supervisor.

Subject to any other provision in this Ordinance, all correspondence between a school and the Permanent Secretary or any public officer concerning the management of the school shall be conducted on behalf of the school by the supervisor. (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

subsection.leadIn: The supervisor of a school shall within 1 month after the happening of such event give notice in writing to the Permanent Secretary if— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any person ceases to be a manager of the school;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the supervisor ceases to perform the duties of the supervisor;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the principal ceases to perform the duties of the principal;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any teacher commences to teach or is employed to teach at the school;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any teacher ceases to teach or ceases to be employed to teach at the school;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the supervisor becomes aware of a change in any particulars furnished under this Ordinance with respect to any landlord or tenant of the premises in which the school is operated.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (2) shall specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the full name and address of the person to whom the notice relates and, if he is a registered or permitted teacher, his registration number or permitted teacher reference number; and (Amended L.N. 162 of 1993)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date of the event referred to in the notice.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Duties of management committee in absence of supervisor
section.content: Without prejudice to section 38(1), if at any time there is no supervisor of a school, the duties of the supervisor under this Ordinance shall be performed by the management committee until a supervisor is approved by the Permanent Secretary, and in such case any notice which is to be served or which may be served under this Ordinance on the supervisor may be served on any manager of the school.

part.name: P3B
part.heading: Management of IMC Schools

section.name: s40AA
section.heading: Application of certain provisions of this Part
section.content: Sections 40AD to 40BI apply to IMC schools only.

section.name: s40AB
section.heading: Interpretation of Part IIIB
section.leadIn: In this Part, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: alternate manager (替代校董) means an alternate parent manager, alternate sponsoring body manager or alternate teacher manager;
alternate parent manager (替代家長校董) means a manager who is nominated under section 40AO for registration as such;
alternate sponsoring body manager (替代辦學團體校董) means a manager who is nominated for registration as such under section 40AM;
alternate teacher manager (替代教員校董) means a manager who is elected under section 40AN for registration as such;
alumni manager (校友校董) means a manager who is nominated for registration as such under section 40AP;
bi-sessional school (上下午班制學校) means a school the registration of which under this Ordinance covers an A.M. session and a P.M. session using the same school premises;
independent manager (獨立校董) means a manager who is nominated for registration as such under section 40AQ;

def.name: Parent
def.leadIn: parent (家長), in relation to a pupil, includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a guardian of the pupil; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person who is not the parent or guardian of the pupil but has the actual custody of the pupil;

section.def: parent manager (家長校董) means a manager who is nominated for registration as such under section 40AO;
recognized alumni association (認可校友會), in relation to a school, means an association recognized under section 40AP(1);
recognized parent-teacher association (認可家長教師會), in relation to a school, means a parent-teacher association recognized under section 40AO(1);
scheduled opening date (預計開課日期), in relation to a school, means the scheduled date on which the school commences operation as agreed between the sponsoring body and the Permanent Secretary;

def.name: SpecialistStaff
def.leadIn: specialist staff (專責人員), in relation to a special school, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any person employed to work for the school as a school social worker, speech therapist, physiotherapist, occupational therapist, occupational therapist assistant, educational psychologist, nurse, warden, assistant warden, houseparent-in-charge, houseparent, programme worker or brailling staff; and

paragraph.name: b

section.def: specified school (指明學校) means a school specified in Schedule 3;
sponsoring body manager (辦學團體校董) means a manager who is nominated for registration as such under section 40AM;

def.name: Teacher
def.leadIn: teacher (教員) means a permitted teacher or registered teacher employed in a school—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to occupy a teacher post in the establishment of staff provided for in the code of aid for primary schools, code of aid for secondary schools or code of aid for special schools; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a term for not less than 12 months to perform teaching duties or other duties directly related to teaching;

section.def: teacher manager (教員校董) means a manager who is nominated for registration as such under section 40AN.

subsection.content: The Secretary for Education may by notice published in the Gazette amend Schedule 3. (Amended L.N. 130 of 2007)

subsection.leadIn: A school shall not be specified in Schedule 3 unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the school is a primary school or secondary school;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the school is neither an aided school nor a DSS school;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the school is a school without IMC;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the school is not operated for the purpose of making profit;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the sponsoring body of the school is not a profit-making organization;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the school receives any subsidy from the Government; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the school is, in the opinion of the Permanent Secretary, financially sound.

section.name: s40AD
section.heading: Incorporated management committee to manage school
section.content: When an incorporated management committee has been established in respect of a school, the school shall, subject to section 40AE, be managed by the incorporated management committee.

section.name: s40AE
section.heading: Functions of sponsoring body and incorporated management committee

subsection.leadIn: The sponsoring body of a school shall be responsible for—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: setting the vision and mission for the school;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: maintaining full control of the use of funds and assets owned by it;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: deciding the mode of receiving government aid;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: ensuring, through the sponsoring body managers, that the mission is carried out;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: giving general directions to the incorporated management committee in the formulation of education policies of the school;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: overseeing the performance of the incorporated management committee; and

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: drafting the constitution of the incorporated management committee.

subsection.leadIn: The incorporated management committee of a school shall be responsible for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: formulating education policies of the school in accordance with the vision and mission set by the sponsoring body;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: planning and managing financial and human resources available to the school;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: accounting to the Permanent Secretary and the sponsoring body for the performance of the school;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: ensuring that the mission of the school is carried out;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: ensuring that the education of the pupils of the school is promoted in a proper manner; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: school planning and self-improvement of the school.

subsection.content: An incorporated management committee of a school may do anything that appears to it to be necessary or expedient for the purposes of, or in connection with, the proper management, administration or operation of the school in accordance with the vision and mission and the general educational policies and principles set by the sponsoring body of the school.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), an incorporated management committee of a school may—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: engage the service of such professionals or other persons as it thinks fit and determine their remuneration;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: use and dispose of the funds and assets owned by it;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: handle funds and assets received from the Government in the capacity of a trustee;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: open and operate bank accounts and invest its funds in such manner and to such extent as it thinks fit;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: borrow money in such manner and on such security or terms as may be expedient;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: apply for and receive any grant in aid on such terms as may be expedient;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: solicit and receive gifts or donations, whether on trust or otherwise, and act as trustee of moneys or other property vested in it on trust;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: enter into any contract, agreement or arrangement; and

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: do such other things as are provided for by this Ordinance or as are necessary for, or incidental or conducive to, the furtherance of the object of the school.

subsection.leadIn: The exercise of the power of an incorporated management committee shall be subject to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the provisions of this Ordinance or any other law;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: guidelines (if any) issued by the sponsoring body of the school for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: raising funds (including borrowing money); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: entering into any contract, agreement or arrangement involving funds other than funds received from the Government;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: (in the case of an aided school) the relevant code of aid;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: (in the case of a non-aided school in receipt of Government subsidies) the terms and conditions for receiving subsidies from the Government (if applicable).

subsection.content: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (3), if a person is employed by the incorporated management committee of an aided school to occupy a post in the establishment of staff provided for in the relevant code of aid, his terms and conditions of service determined pursuant to subsection (2)(b) must conform with those provided for in the relevant code of aid in relation to the post.

def.name: RelevantCodeOfAid
def.leadIn: In this section, relevant code of aid (有關的資助則例) means— (Amended E.R. 1 of 2021)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to an aided school which is a primary school, the code of aid for primary schools;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to an aided school which is a secondary school, the code of aid for secondary schools;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to an aided school which is a special school, a practical school or a skills opportunity school, the code of aid for special schools.

section.name: s40AG
section.heading: Power of sponsoring body over employment of teaching staff

subsection.leadIn: The sponsoring body of a school which is also the sponsoring body of another school—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: may request—

subparagraph.name: i
ii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: may request—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: the incorporated management committee of the other school to employ the person as a teacher of the same rank of the school.

subsection.leadIn: A sponsoring body shall not request the taking of any action under subsection (1) unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the action is conducive to the professional development of the person concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the action is necessary to avoid or alleviate over-establishment of staff due to a reduction of classes in the school concerned; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the Permanent Secretary approves the request upon—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an application by the sponsoring body; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: other good cause being shown to his satisfaction.

subsection.content: An incorporated management committee shall take such action within its lawful authority as is necessary for the compliance with a request made of it under subsection (1).

section.name: s40AH
section.heading: Certain property not to vest in incorporated management committee

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, it is declared that no property belonging to and provided by the Government, the sponsoring body or any other person for the operation of a school shall, by reason only of the establishment of the incorporated management committee of the school, become property of the committee.

The incorporated management committee of a school shall hold any subsidy received from the Government in accordance with the code of aid for primary schools, the code of aid for secondary schools or the code of aid for special schools (as may be applicable) as trustee.

section.name: s40AI
section.heading: Irregular establishment, etc. do not affect contract
section.leadIn: The validity of a contract entered into by an incorporated management committee shall not be affected by any irregularity or defectiveness in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the election or nomination of any person for registration as manager of the school;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the registration of any manager of the school as such; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the composition or establishment of the committee.

subsection.content: A school shall have a supervisor.

subsection.leadIn: The supervisor of a school—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be a manager of the school;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must be—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: appointed by the sponsoring body of the school; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: elected by the managers of the school,

paragraph.continued: in accordance with the constitution of the incorporated management committee of the school; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: shall hold and vacate office as such in accordance with the constitution.

subsection.leadIn: If the supervisor of a school is unable to perform his functions during a period of not less than 28 days due to absence from Hong Kong or illness—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: (in the case of an elected supervisor) the other managers shall elect amongst themselves an acting supervisor to act in the place of the supervisor during the period.

subsection.content: The principal or a teacher of the school shall not be the supervisor or act as the supervisor.

subsection.leadIn: The incorporated management committee shall give notice in writing of the assumption of office—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of the first supervisor to the Permanent Secretary within 14 days after its establishment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: of any subsequent supervisor to the Permanent Secretary within 14 days after his election or appointment.

subsection.content: A notice given under subsection (5) shall contain the English and Chinese names of the supervisor and such other information as the Permanent Secretary may specify.

subsection.leadIn: The supervisor of a school shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: preside over the meetings of the incorporated management committee of the school;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: within one month from the happening of any of the following events, give notice of the event to the Permanent Secretary—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any person ceases to be a manager of the school;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the principal of the school ceases to hold office as such;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any teacher of the school is employed to teach or commences teaching at the school;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: any teacher of the school ceases to hold office as such; or

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: there is a change in any particulars furnished under this Ordinance in respect of the tenancy of the school premises;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: sign the statement of accounts of the committee;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: within one month of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the receipt or issue of a writ or other originating process (except one issued in proceedings in the Small Claims Tribunal within the meaning of the Small Claims Tribunal Ordinance (Cap. 338) and the Minor Employment Claims Adjudication Board within the meaning of the Minor Employment Claims Adjudication Board Ordinance (Cap. 453)) by the committee; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the handing down of the judgment in the proceedings to which such writ or originating process relates,

paragraph.continued: give notice in writing of the event to the Permanent Secretary; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: perform such functions as may be provided for in the constitution of the committee.

subsection.leadIn: A notice given under subsection (1)(b) in respect of an event shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in writing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the date of the event; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: specify the name and address of the person to whom the notice relates and, if he is a registered or permitted teacher, his registration number or permitted teacher reference number.

subsection.content: A notice required to be given by the incorporated management committee shall be given in the name of and signed by the supervisor.

part.crossHeading: Composition of incorporated management committee and office of managers

subsection.content: An incorporated management committee shall, subject to the other provisions of this Ordinance, be constituted in accordance with the constitution of the committee.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to subsection (1), the composition of an incorporated management committee as provided for in its constitution shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (3), such number of sponsoring body manager as the school sponsoring body may nominate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the principal of the school, who shall be an ex-officio manager;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: not less than one teacher manager;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: not less than—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: (in the case of a school other than a bi-sessional school) one parent manager; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: (in the case of a bi-sessional school) one parent manager for each of the A.M. session and P.M. session;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: one or more alumni managers where such manager or managers is or are nominated;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: not less than one independent manager;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: not more than one alternate sponsoring body manager;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: where the constitution allows the nomination of not more than one teacher manager, one alternate teacher manager; and

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.leadIn: where the constitution allows the nomination of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: not more than one parent manager, one alternate parent manager; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: (in the case of a bi-sessional school) not more than one parent manager for the A.M. session and one parent manager for the P.M. session, one alternate parent manager for the A.M. session and one alternate parent manager for the P.M. session.

subsection.content: The numbers of sponsoring body manager shall not exceed 60% of the maximum number of managers that the incorporated management committee may have under its constitution.
In calculating the maximum number of managers for the purposes of subsection (3), an alternate manager or a manager appointed under section 41 shall not be counted.
No manager shall serve in an incorporated management committee in more than one capacity mentioned in any paragraph of subsection (2).

section.name: s40AM
section.heading: Nomination of sponsoring body manager
section.leadIn: The sponsoring body of a school may nominate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: such number of persons for registration as sponsoring body manager of the school as may be provided for in the constitution of the incorporated management committee of the school; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person for registration as alternate sponsoring body manager of the school.

subsection.content: The principal of a school shall nominate such number of teachers of the school for registration as teacher manager or alternate teacher manager of the school as may be provided for in the constitution of the incorporated management committee of the school.

subsection.leadIn: A person nominated under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be a teacher of the school;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not be the principal of the school;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: must be elected in that behalf in an election—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: held pursuant to the constitution of the incorporated management committee of the school;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in which all teachers of the school have equal voting right and right of candidature;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the voting for which is conducted by secret ballot; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the system of which is otherwise fair and transparent.

subsection.def: In this section, teachers (教員) includes, in relation to a special school, the specialist staff of the school. (Amended E.R. 1 of 2021)
