subsection.content: The incorporated management committee of a school may recognize one body of persons (however described) as recognized parent-teacher association for the purposes of making nomination under subsection (4).

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding subsection (1), the incorporated management committee of a bi-sessional school may recognize—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: another body of persons (however described) as recognized parent-teacher association in respect of the P.M. session of the bi-sessional school,

subsection.continued: for the purposes of making nomination under subsection (4).

subsection.leadIn: A body of persons shall not be recognized under subsection (1) unless under its constitution only—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: parents of current pupils of the school; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: serving teachers of the school,

subsection.continued: may elect or become office-bearers of the body.

subsection.content: A recognized parent-teacher association may nominate such number of persons for registration as parent manager or alternate parent manager of the school as may be provided for in the constitution of the incorporated management committee of the school.

subsection.leadIn: A person nominated under subsection (4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be a parent of a current pupil of the school;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not be a teacher of the school; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: must be elected in that behalf in an election—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: conducted by the recognized parent-teacher association of the school;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in which all parents of the current pupils of the school have equal voting right and right of candidature;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the voting for which is conducted by secret ballot; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the system of which is otherwise fair and transparent.

subsection.content: The incorporated management committee or sponsoring body of a school, as may be provided for in the constitution of the committee may recognize one body of persons (however described) as recognized alumni association for the purposes of making nomination under subsection (4).

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding subsection (1), the incorporated management committee or sponsoring body of a bi-sessional school, as may be provided for in the constitution of the committee may recognize—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: one body of persons (however described) as recognized alumni association in respect of the A.M. session of the bi-sessional school; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: another body of persons (however described) as recognized alumni association in respect of the P.M. session of the bi-sessional school,

subsection.continued: for the purposes of making nomination under subsection (4).

subsection.leadIn: A body of persons shall not be recognized under subsection (1) unless under its constitution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: its membership is open to all alumni of the school;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: only the alumni of the school may elect or become office-bearers of the body; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the system of election held for the purposes of making nomination under subsection (4) is fair and transparent.

subsection.continued: In this subsection, a reference to school includes a reference to the A.M. session or P.M. session of a bi-sessional school.

subsection.content: A recognized alumni association may nominate such number of persons for registration as alumni manager of the school as may be provided for in the constitution of the incorporated management committee of the school.

If no person is nominated under subsection (4) in respect of a school, the incorporated management committee may nominate such number of persons for registration as alumni manager of the school as may be provided for in its constitution.

subsection.leadIn: A person nominated under subsection (4) or (5)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be an alumnus of the school; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not be a teacher of the school.

subsection.content: The incorporated management committee of a school may nominate such number of persons for registration as independent manager of the school as may be provided for in the constitution of the committee.

subsection.leadIn: The following persons shall not be nominated under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a teacher or (where applicable) specialist staff of the school;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a parent of a current pupil of the school;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an alumnus of the school; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: a person who is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a member;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the spouse or a grand-parent, parent, brother, sister, child or grand-child of a member; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: an employee,

paragraph.continued: of the governing body (however described) of the sponsoring body of the school.

subsection.content: The first independent manager of a school may be registered as such at any time within one year from the establishment of the incorporated management committee of the school.

subsection.leadIn: If the incorporated management committee of a school is established under section 40BX—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the first parent manager of a school shall be nominated for registration as such at any time within 3 years from the establishment of the committee.

subsection.content: If the incorporated management committee of a school is established under section 40BN, the first parent manager of the school shall be nominated for registration as such at any time within 3 months from the establishment of the committee.
An incorporated management committee may apply to the Permanent Secretary for exemption from any requirement of this Ordinance on its composition.
An application under subsection (4) shall be made in such manner as the Permanent Secretary may specify.

subsection.leadIn: The Permanent Secretary shall decide an application under subsection (4) by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: where he is satisfied that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the incorporated management committee has taken all reasonable steps to secure compliance with the requirement; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it is reasonable in the circumstances of the case to grant the exemption applied for,

paragraph.continued: granting the exemption subject to such condition (if any) as he thinks fit; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where he is not satisfied in the manner prescribed in paragraph (a), refusing to grant the exemption.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application under this section is pending; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an exemption has been granted under this section,

subsection.continued: the Permanent Secretary shall not take any action under section 22, 31 or 41 in respect of the school concerned only because any requirement on the composition of the incorporated management committee is not complied with.

subsection.content: Subject to this section, an alternate manager shall for all purposes be regarded as a manager.

subsection.leadIn: An alternate sponsoring body manager of a school shall not vote on any matter to be resolved by the incorporated management committee by voting unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: (in the case of a matter to be resolved at a meeting of the committee) any sponsoring body manager of the school is absent from the meeting;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (in the case of a matter to be resolved otherwise) any sponsoring body manager of the school is, for any reason, unable to vote on the matter.

subsection.leadIn: An alternate teacher manager of a school shall not vote on any matter to be resolved by the incorporated management committee by voting unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: (in the case of a matter to be resolved at a meeting of the committee) no teacher manager of the school is present at the meeting;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (in the case of a matter to be resolved otherwise) the school has no teacher manager for the time being.

subsection.leadIn: An alternate parent manager of a school shall not vote on any matter to be resolved by the incorporated management committee by voting unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: (in the case of a matter to be resolved at a meeting of the committee) no parent manager of the school is present at the meeting;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (in the case of a matter to be resolved otherwise) the school has no parent manager for the time being.

subsection.leadIn: In ascertaining the majority of the managers of a school for the purposes of section 56(1)(d) or 57(1)(d)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an alternate sponsoring body manager shall not be counted unless there is a vacancy of sponsoring body manager of the school for the time being;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an alternate teacher manager shall not be counted unless the school has no teacher manager for the time being; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an alternate parent manager shall not be counted unless the school has no parent manager for the time being.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of establishing a quorum of a meeting of incorporated management committee—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: an alternate teacher manager of the school shall not be counted unless no teacher manager of the school is present at the meeting; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an alternate parent manager of the school shall not be counted unless no parent manager of the school is present at the meeting.

subsection.content: An alternate manager shall not only because of his being a manager incur any liability for an act done pursuant to a voting of the incorporated management committee in which he has not participated by virtue of subsection (2), (3) or (4).
An alternate teacher manager and a teacher manager of a school shall be elected in the same manner for nomination for registration as a manager.
An alternate parent manager and a parent manager of a school shall be elected in the same manner for nomination for registration as a manager.
In subsections (4) and (6), a reference to school includes a reference to the A.M. session or P.M. session of a bi-sessional school.

section.name: s40AT
section.heading: Endorsement of application for registration as manager
section.leadIn: If a person is nominated for registration as a manager of a school under this Part and he applies for such registration, his application shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: endorsed by the body or person that nominates him; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (where he is on the list of proposed managers referred to in section 40BM(1)(a) or 40BW(1)(a)) endorsed by the sponsoring body in such manner as the Permanent Secretary may specify.

section.name: s40AU
section.heading: Filling of vacancies to maintain full composition

subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, an incorporated management committee fails to maintain its full composition if by reason of any vacancy in the office of a manager, its composition does not comply with the provisions of this Part and its constitution.

subsection.leadIn: The incorporated management committee shall, within three months from the date on which the failure to maintain full composition arises—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: ensure that a person qualified to fill the vacancy is nominated for registration as a manager; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: forward to the Permanent Secretary an application by the person for registration as a manager.

subsection.content: The Permanent Secretary may extend the period mentioned in subsection (2) if the incorporated management committee so requests on good grounds within the period.

For the purposes of subsection (2), a person is qualified to fill the vacancy if he is nominated for registration as a manager in the same manner as the manager who ceased to hold the office concerned.

section.name: s40AV
section.heading: Parent manager or independent manager ceases to hold office under certain circumstances

subsection.content: If a parent manager ceases to be a parent of a current pupil of the school in a school year, his term of office as a manager shall continue until its expiry or the end of the school year, whichever is the earlier.

If in a school year an independent manager becomes a person referred to in section 40AQ(2)(a), (b) or (d), his term of office as a manager shall continue until its expiry or the end of the school year, whichever is the earlier.

subsection.leadIn: If a manager—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: resigns from his office as a manager in accordance with the constitution of the incorporated management committee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: passes away,

subsection.continued: the committee shall give a written notice of the event to the Permanent Secretary.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the principal of a school ceases to be the principal; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a teacher manager or alternate teacher manager of a school ceases to be employed in the school,

subsection.continued: he shall for the purposes of subsection (1) be deemed to have resigned from his office as a manager in accordance with the constitution of the incorporated management committee of the school.

subsection.content: An incorporated management committee shall, upon receiving a request under subsection (2), (3), (4) or (5), issue a notice in writing to the Permanent Secretary as regards the cancellation of the registration of the manager specified in the request.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the teachers and (where applicable) specialist staff of a school pass a resolution that any teacher manager or alternate teacher manager of the school is not suitable to continue to hold office as such; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the resolution is passed in a manner which is, as far as reasonably practicable, similar to the manner in which the manager is elected for nomination,

subsection.continued: the principal of the school shall make a written request to the incorporated management committee to issue a notice under subsection (1) in respect of the manager.

subsection.content: The recognized parent-teacher association of a school may make a written request to the incorporated management committee to issue a notice under subsection (1) in respect of any parent manager or alternate parent manager of the school specified in the request.

The recognized alumni association of a school may make a written request to the incorporated management committee to issue a notice under subsection (1) in respect of any alumni manager of the school specified in the request.

The sponsoring body of a school may make a written request to the incorporated management committee to issue a notice under subsection (1) in respect of any sponsoring body manager of the school specified in the request.

subsection.leadIn: A request made under subsection (3), (4) or (5) shall not have effect unless it is authorized by a resolution passed by the maker of the request—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the ground that the manager concerned is not suitable to continue to hold office; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in a manner which is, as far as reasonably practicable, similar to the manner in which the manager concerned is elected for nomination.

subsection.content: The incorporated management committee of a school may issue a written notice to the Permanent Secretary as regards the cancellation of the registration of any independent manager of the school.
In subsections (3) and (4), a reference to school includes a reference to the A.M. session or P.M. session of a bi-sessional school.

subsection.leadIn: An incorporated management committee shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: have a written constitution which is approved by the Permanent Secretary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: conduct its affairs in accordance with its constitution.

subsection.content: An incorporated management committee may by resolution amend its constitution in the manner provided for in the constitution.

subsection.leadIn: An amendment to the constitution of an incorporated management committee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be lodged with the Permanent Secretary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not take effect before the expiry of one month after it is so lodged.

subsection.content: The Permanent Secretary may, by notice in writing to the incorporated management committee concerned, object to an amendment lodged with him before the amendment takes effect. The reason for the objection shall be specified in the notice.
Subject to section 66(1)(ba), an amendment objected to by the Permanent Secretary shall be void.

The Permanent Secretary may, by notice to an incorporated management committee, require its constitution to be amended in such manner as he may specify to secure compliance with law and general education policies. The committee shall amend its constitution accordingly.
Subsections (3) and (4) do not apply to an amendment under subsection (6).

subsection.leadIn: If an objection under subsection (4) to an amendment of constitution which is intended to take effect on a certain date (original effective date) is reversed under section 64, the amendment shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: where the Permanent Secretary does not appeal against the reversal under section 65 within the period of 14 days referred to in that section, take effect—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: at the expiry of that period; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: on the original effective date,

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where the Permanent Secretary appeals against the reversal under section 65 and the reversal is upheld, take effect on—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date on which the reversal is upheld; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the original effective date,

subsection.content: The incorporated management committee shall, as soon as practicable after any amendment to its constitution takes effect, lodge a copy of its constitution as amended with the Permanent Secretary.

An incorporated management committee may, either generally or for a particular purpose, delegate any function conferred on it by this Ordinance (except section 40AE and regulation 76 of the Education Regulations (Cap. 279 sub. leg. A)) to any manager of the school.

Where a manager performs a function conferred by this Ordinance on the incorporated management committee, the committee shall, unless the contrary is proved, be deemed to have delegated that function to that manager.

subsection.leadIn: Where there is a delegation under subsection (1), the manager shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: report to the incorporated management committee on any act done pursuant to the delegated function; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make such report at the meeting of the committee immediately following the doing of the act.

subsection.content: A delegated function which is duly performed by a delegate shall be regarded as having been performed by the incorporated management committee.
A function which has been delegated may be performed by the incorporated management committee notwithstanding the delegation.

section.name: s40BA
section.heading: Permanent Secretary’s nominee may attend meeting
section.leadIn: If it appears to the Permanent Secretary that the attendance of a meeting of the incorporated management committee of the school by a public officer will be conducive to the operation and performance of the school—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Permanent Secretary may, by notice in writing to the committee, nominate the public officer to attend the meeting; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the public officer may attend the meeting and offer such advice at the meeting as he thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: An incorporated management committee shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: maintain proper books of account and other financial and accounting records as stipulated in—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: such instructions as may be given by the Permanent Secretary for the purposes of this paragraph from time to time;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: cause to be prepared for each accounting year of the committee statements of the accounts of the committee; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: submit the statement of accounts to the Permanent Secretary at such time and in such manner as the Permanent Secretary may specify.

subsection.leadIn: The statement of accounts mentioned in subsection (1) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: include an income and expenditure account and balance sheet; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be authenticated by the signatures of the supervisor of the school and one other manager authorized by the incorporated management committee of the school to act for that purpose, either generally or specifically.

subsection.content: An incorporated management committee shall appoint an accountant as the auditor.

subsection.leadIn: The auditor appointed under subsection (3) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: audit the accounts prepared under subsection (1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: report as to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: whether such account and balance sheet present fairly the financial transactions of the incorporated management committee during the accounting year to which the account and balance sheet relate; and

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: submit the report to the Permanent Secretary at such time as the Permanent Secretary may specify;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: be entitled to require such information and explanations as he considers necessary for discharging his duties; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: comply with such directions as may be given by the Permanent Secretary for the purposes of this paragraph from time to time.

subsection.leadIn: The incorporated management committee shall permit—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Permanent Secretary;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any inspector of schools; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the auditor appointed under subsection (3),

subsection.continued: to inspect the books of account and all vouchers, receipts, invoices, documents and records in the committee’s control which are relevant to the financial transactions of the committee.

subsection.def: In this section, accountant (會計師) means a certified public accountant (practising) as defined by section 2(1) of the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588). (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

section.name: s40BC
section.heading: Service of documents
section.content: A document may be served on an incorporated management committee by leaving it at, or sending it by post to, the registered office of the committee.

section.name: s40BD
section.heading: Restrictions on execution of judgment by writ of fieri facias
section.leadIn: In the execution of a judgment against an incorporated management committee of a school by writ of fieri facias, any property that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: located in the school premises; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: used in connection with giving instructions to the pupils of the school,

section.name: s40BE
section.heading: Dissolution
section.leadIn: On the cancellation of the registration or provisional registration of a school under section 22—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the incorporated management committee shall be dissolved;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name of the committee shall be removed from the register of incorporated management committees; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the properties owned by the committee immediately before its dissolution shall be vested in the Permanent Secretary as the corporation sole constituted under the Permanent Secretary for Education Incorporation Ordinance (Cap. 1098) who shall— (Amended L.N. 130 of 2007)

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: where after such settlement (if any) any property which was donated to the committee remains, return the property to the donor unless the donor indicated at the time of the donation that he did not wish to reclaim the property in the event of the dissolution of the committee;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: where after such settlement or return (if any) any property remains, apply the property towards any purpose which is conducive to education in Hong Kong.

section.name: s40BF
section.heading: Declaration of pecuniary or other personal interests annually

subsection.leadIn: A manager of a school shall, at least once in every 12 months, make to the incorporated management committee of the school a written declaration which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: states the particulars of any pecuniary or other personal interest, direct or indirect, that he has in any matter that raises or may raise a conflict with his duties as a manager of the school; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: states that he has no such interest.

subsection.content: Within one month after a change occurs in any matter stated in a declaration, the manager who made the declaration shall make to the incorporated management committee another written declaration which states the change.

A manager shall, if so required by the incorporated management committee, provide the committee with such further information as it thinks necessary to establish any particular contained in a declaration made by him.
A manager shall not make a declaration under subsection (1) or (2) which he knows to be false or misleading in a material particular.

section.name: s40BG
section.heading: Disclosure of pecuniary or other personal interests

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a manager has any pecuniary or other personal interest, direct or indirect, in a matter that is considered or is to be considered at a meeting of the incorporated management committee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the matter appears to raise a conflict with the proper performance of the manager’s duties in relation to the consideration of the matter,

subsection.continued: that manager shall disclose the nature of the interest at the meeting or (if he does not attend the meeting) by giving a notice in writing to the committee before the meeting.

subsection.leadIn: A disclosure under subsection (1) by a manager that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he or any nominee of him is a member of a specified company or other body;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he is an officer or employee of a specified company or other body;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: he is a partner or is in the employment of a specified person; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: he has some other specified interest relating to a specified company or other body or to a specified person,

subsection.continued: is a sufficient disclosure of the nature of the interest in any matter relating to that company or other body or to that person which may arise after the date of the disclosure and which is required to be disclosed under subsection (1). In this subsection, specified (指明) means specified in the notice given by the manager under subsection (1).

subsection.content: A disclosure made under subsection (1) shall be recorded in the minutes of the meeting concerned.

subsection.leadIn: After a manager has disclosed the nature of any interest in a matter, he shall not, unless the incorporated management committee otherwise determines—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be present during any deliberation of the committee with respect to the matter; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take part in any deliberation or decision of the committee with respect to the matter.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of the making of a determination by the incorporated management committee under subsection (4), a manager who has any pecuniary or other personal interest in a matter to which the disclosure relates must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be present during any deliberation of the committee for the purpose of making the determination; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take part in the making by the committee of the determination.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, a manager who is a person employed to work at the school shall not be treated as having any pecuniary or other personal interest in a matter merely because—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: he has an interest in the matter which is no greater than the interest of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: (where he is employed as a teacher) the generality of teachers of the school;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: (where he is employed otherwise than as a teacher) the generality of persons employed to work at the school otherwise than as teachers;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the matter under consideration or discussion concerns the exercise by the incorporated management committee of its function relating to the curriculum for the school; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the matter under consideration or discussion involves expenditure of the committee.

subsection.content: Managers shall not, by reason of any pecuniary or other personal interest in a matter, be prevented from considering and voting on proposals for the incorporated management committee to take out insurance protecting the managers against liabilities incurred by them arising out of their office. The committee shall not, by reason of the interest of the managers, be prevented from obtaining such insurance and paying the premium.
A contravention of this section does not invalidate a decision of the incorporated management committee.

section.name: s40BH
section.heading: Register of interests
section.leadIn: The incorporated management committee of a school shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: keep a register of all declarations made under section 40BF;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: keep a register of all disclosures made under section 40BG;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: permit any inspector of schools to inspect the register kept under paragraph (a) or (b) at any reasonable time to enable the Permanent Secretary to ascertain whether section 40BF or 40BG, as the case may be, is complied with; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: permit the public to inspect the register kept under paragraph (b) at any reasonable time.

section.name: s40BI
section.heading: Rights and liability of manager and protection

subsection.content: A manager shall not by virtue of his office as the manager be beneficially interested in any property of the incorporated management committee.

A manager shall not incur any civil liability in respect of anything done or omitted to be done by him in good faith in the performance or purported performance of any function of his office as the manager.

No civil proceedings shall be brought against a manager of a school for anything done or omitted to be done by or on behalf of the incorporated management committee of the school unless he has not acted in good faith in relation to the thing or omission.

The protection conferred under subsection (2) does not in any way affect the liability, if any, of the incorporated management committee for the act or omission of the manager in the performance or purported performance of the relevant function.

part.crossHeading: Establishment of incorporated management committee: operating school

section.name: s40BJ
section.heading: Establishment of incorporated management committee in respect of operating DSS school or specified school
section.leadIn: The sponsoring body of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a DSS school which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is a school without IMC; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has commenced operation (whether or not before 1 January 2005); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a specified school,

section.continued: may notify the Permanent Secretary in writing of its intention to establish an incorporated management committee in respect of the school.

section.name: s40BK
section.heading: Submission for the purpose of establishment of incorporated management committee in respect of operating school

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an aided school which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is a school without IMC; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has commenced operation before 1 January 2005;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a DSS school in respect of which a notice has been given under section 40BJ; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a specified school in respect of which a notice has been given under section 40BJ.

subsection.content: The sponsoring body of a school shall submit to the Permanent Secretary a draft of the constitution of the proposed incorporated management committee.

subsection.leadIn: A submission made under subsection (2) shall be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of an aided school, by 1 July 2011; (Amended L.N. 112 of 2009)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a DSS school or specified school, within 6 months from the date of the notice given under section 40BJ in respect of the school.

subsection.content: The sponsoring body shall provide to the Permanent Secretary such further information relating to the submission as he may reasonably require for the purpose of enabling him to exercise his power under section 40BL or 40BM.

The Legislative Council may, by a resolution passed after 1 October 2008 but before 1 July 2009, amend subsection (3)(a) by repealing “1 July 2009” and substituting a date after 1 July 2009 but before 2 July 2011.

section.name: s40BL
section.heading: Approval of draft constitution
section.content: The Permanent Secretary shall approve or refuse to approve a draft of a constitution submitted under section 40BK(2) in accordance with any regulation made under section 84 for the purposes of this section.

section.name: s40BM
section.heading: Approval of list of proposed managers

subsection.leadIn: Upon the approval of the draft constitution by the Permanent Secretary, the sponsoring body shall submit to the Permanent Secretary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a list of the proposed managers of the school; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an application by each proposed manager for registration as a manager of the school that complies with section 28.

subsection.leadIn: The Permanent Secretary shall approve a list of proposed managers submitted under subsection (1) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the composition of the proposed incorporated management committee—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: complies with this Part; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is consistent with the draft of the constitution as approved under section 40BL; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: having regard to the grounds prescribed in section 30, he is satisfied that all the proposed managers are fit for registration as a manager of the school.

subsection.leadIn: If the Permanent Secretary approves—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a draft of a constitution under section 40BL; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a list of proposed managers under section 40BM,

subsection.continued: he shall—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: register the proposed managers as managers of the school under section 29; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: issue a certificate of incorporation in such form as he may specify.

subsection.leadIn: With effect from the date of incorporation specified in the certificate of incorporation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the supervisor of the school shall cease to be the supervisor of the school;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all managers of the school who hold office as such immediately before that date shall cease to be managers of the school; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the incorporated management committee shall be established as a body corporate with perpetual succession.

subsection.leadIn: The incorporated management committee established under subsection (2) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: have—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an English name in the form “The Incorporated Management Committee of (the registered English name of the school)”; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a Chinese name in the form “(the registered Chinese name of the school) 法團校董會”;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: have a common seal, the affixing of which shall be pursuant to its resolution and be authenticated by the signatures of the supervisor of the school and one other manager authorized by the committee to act for that purpose, either generally or specifically; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: have a registered office at the address of the premises which are specified in the certificate of registration or certificate of provisional registration of the school.

subsection.content: No compensation is payable by the Government to any person who ceases to be a supervisor or manager by virtue of the operation of this section.

section.name: s40BO
section.heading: Effect of certificate of incorporation
section.content: A certificate of incorporation issued under section 40BN shall be conclusive evidence that the incorporated management committee is duly established under this Ordinance.

section.name: s40BP
section.heading: Transitional provisions for establishment of incorporated management committee

subsection.content: Schedule 1 has effect in relation to the establishment of the incorporated management committee of a school which does not have a school management company.
The Secretary for Education may by notice published in the Gazette amend Schedule 1. (Amended L.N. 130 of 2007)
This section applies where a school management company has been incorporated for the purposes of operating a school.

On the date of establishment of the incorporated management committee of the school under section 40BN, the school management company of the school is deemed to be dissolved under section 748 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) as if the Court of First Instance had made on that date an order under that section that the company be struck off the register of companies and dissolved.

The Registrar of Companies shall, on the date of establishment of the incorporated management committee of the school, or as soon as reasonably practicable after that day, strike the school management company of the school off the register of companies.

subsection.leadIn: This section has effect notwithstanding—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any provision in the articles of association of the school management company governing its winding up or dissolution; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the provisions of any other Ordinance.

subsection.content: Sections 752, 758 and 765(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) shall not apply to a school management company which is deemed under subsection (2) to be dissolved.

section.name: s40BR
section.heading: Transitional provisions for dissolution of school management company

subsection.content: Schedule 2 has effect in relation to the dissolution of the school management company of a school under section 40BQ on the establishment of the incorporated management committee of the school.
The Secretary for Education may by notice published in the Gazette amend Schedule 2. (Amended L.N. 130 of 2007)

section.name: s40BS
section.heading: Failure to establish incorporated management committee

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the sponsoring body of an aided school fails to comply with section 40BK; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Permanent Secretary refuses to issue a certificate of incorporation under section 40BN in respect of the school,

subsection.continued: the Permanent Secretary may—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: without prejudice to section 41, appoint one or more persons to be the managers of the school; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: without prejudice to section 31, cancel the registration of any manager of the school.

subsection.leadIn: A manager appointed under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: shall hold office until—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the term of office for which he is appointed expires; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the incorporated management committee of the school is established,

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall for the purpose of this Ordinance be treated as a manager appointed under section 41.

subsection.content: The Government shall not incur any civil liability only by reason of the exercise by the Permanent Secretary of his power under subsection (1).

part.crossHeading: Establishment of incorporated management committee: planned school

section.name: s40BT
section.heading: Establishment of incorporated management committee in respect of planned DSS school
section.content: The sponsoring body of a DSS school the scheduled opening date of which falls on or after 1 January 2005 may notify the Permanent Secretary in writing of its intention to establish an incorporated management committee in respect of the school.

section.name: s40BU
section.heading: Submission for the purpose of establishment of incorporated management committee in respect of planned school

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an aided school the scheduled opening date of which falls on or after 1 January 2005; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a DSS school in respect of which a notice has been given under section 40BT.

subsection.leadIn: The sponsoring body of a school shall submit to the Permanent Secretary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a draft of the constitution of the proposed incorporated management committee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an application for registration of the school under section 11.

subsection.leadIn: A submission made under subsection (2) shall be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: not later than 6 months before the scheduled opening date; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by such later date as the Permanent Secretary may approve in writing.

subsection.content: The sponsoring body shall provide to the Permanent Secretary such further information relating to the submission as he may reasonably require for the purposes of enabling him to exercise his power under section 40BV or 40BW.

section.name: s40BV
section.heading: Approval of draft constitution
section.content: The Permanent Secretary shall approve or refuse to approve a draft of a constitution submitted under section 40BU(2) in accordance with any regulation made under section 84 for the purposes of this section.

section.name: s40BW
section.heading: Approval of list of proposed managers

subsection.leadIn: Upon the approval of the draft constitution by the Permanent Secretary, the sponsoring body shall submit to the Permanent Secretary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a list of the proposed managers of the school; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an application by each proposed manager for registration as a manager of the school that complies with section 28.

subsection.leadIn: The Permanent Secretary shall approve a list of proposed managers submitted under subsection (1) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the composition of the proposed incorporated management committee—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: complies with this Part; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is consistent with the draft of the constitution as approved under section 40BV; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: having regard to the grounds prescribed in section 30, he is satisfied that all the proposed managers are fit for registration as a manager of the school.

subsection.leadIn: If the Permanent Secretary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: approves a draft of a constitution under section 40BV;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: approves a list of proposed managers under section 40BW; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: registers the school under section 13 or 15,

subsection.continued: he shall—

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: register the proposed managers as managers of the school under section 29; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: issue a certificate of incorporation in such form as he may specify.

subsection.content: With effect from the date of incorporation specified in the certificate of incorporation, the incorporated management committee shall be established as a body corporate with perpetual succession.

subsection.leadIn: The incorporated management committee established under subsection (2) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: have—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an English name in the form “The Incorporated Management Committee of (the registered English name of the school)”; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a Chinese name in the form “(the registered Chinese name of the school) 法團校董會”;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: have a common seal, the affixing of which shall be pursuant to its resolution and be authenticated by the signatures of the supervisor of the school and one other manager authorized by the committee to act for that purpose, either generally or specifically; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: have a registered office at the address of the premises which are specified in the certificate of registration or certificate of provisional registration of the school.

section.name: s40BY
section.heading: Effect of certificate of incorporation
section.content: A certificate of incorporation issued under section 40BX shall be conclusive evidence that the incorporated management committee is duly established under this Ordinance.

section.name: s40BZ
section.heading: Failure to establish incorporated management committee

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the scheduled opening date of an aided school falls on or after 1 January 2005 and the sponsoring body of the school fails to comply with section 40BU; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Permanent Secretary refuses to issue a certificate of incorporation under section 40BX in respect of the school,

subsection.continued: any agreement between the Government and the sponsoring body in relation to the sponsorship, subsidization, management and operation of the school shall, at the option of the Permanent Secretary, terminate on a day specified by him.

subsection.content: The Government shall not incur any civil liability only by reason of the exercise by the Permanent Secretary of his option under subsection (1).

section.name: s40CA
section.heading: Pre-incorporation contract
section.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: he enters into the contract with the written authority of the sponsoring body of the school;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: before he enters into the contract he advises the other party that the incorporated management committee of the school will upon its establishment become a party to the contract by virtue of this section; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the contract is subsisting immediately before the establishment of the committee,

section.continued: the following provisions apply on the establishment of the committee—

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the committee shall for all purposes substitute for the person as the party to the contract and shall be regarded as having always been the party;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: all rights and liabilities of the person under the contract shall vest in the committee; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the person shall cease to be a party to the contract.

part.crossHeading: Provisions applicable where a school ceases to be an IMC school

section.name: s40CB
section.heading: An aided IMC school may become a DSS school without IMC

subsection.content: If an IMC school which is an aided school becomes a DSS school, the sponsoring body of the school may apply to the Permanent Secretary for an approval for the school to become a school without IMC.

subsection.leadIn: The Permanent Secretary shall grant an approval applied for if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all conditions (if any) subject to which the school may become a DSS school have been fulfilled;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a company has been incorporated under the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622), or under the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 32) as in force at the time of the incorporation, for the purposes of operating the school as stated in its articles of association; (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the company has been designated as a school management company under section 3(2);

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: a person has been recommended under section 38 to be the supervisor of the DSS school.

subsection.leadIn: Upon the granting of an approval in relation to a school—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the incorporated management committee shall be dissolved;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name of the committee shall be removed from the register of incorporated management committees; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Schedule 2 has effect in relation to the dissolution of the committee.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Appointment of managers by Permanent Secretary

subsection.leadIn: If it appears to the Permanent Secretary— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that a school is not being managed satisfactorily or that the education of the pupils is not being promoted in a proper manner;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the composition of the management committee of a school is such that the school is not likely to be managed satisfactorily, or is such that the education of the pupils is not likely to be promoted in a proper manner; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that for any reason a school has no manager, (Added 61 of 1982 s. 4)

subsection.continued: he may appoint one or more persons to be managers of the school for such period as he thinks fit. (Amended 61 of 1982 s. 4)

subsection.leadIn: A person who is appointed by the Permanent Secretary under subsection (1) to be a manager of a school— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be deemed to be registered as a manager of the school under section 29(1); (Amended 42 of 1993 s. 16)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall perform his functions in accordance with any directions given to him by the Permanent Secretary; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may enter the school premises at all reasonable times.

subsection.content: Notwithstanding subsections (1) and (2), no person who is appointed by the Permanent Secretary under subsection (1) to be a manager of a school shall participate in any of the profits of the school or shall be liable for any financial obligations incurred by the management committee or incorporated management committee (as may be appropriate) in respect of the operation of the school. (Amended 27 of 2004 s. 18)

part.name: P4
part.heading: Teachers

section.name: s42
section.heading: Teachers to be registered or permitted teachers

subsection.leadIn: No person shall teach in a school unless he is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a registered teacher; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a permitted teacher.

subsection.content: No permitted teacher shall teach in a school otherwise than in accordance with the conditions or limitations specified in the permit to teach issued in respect of such teacher.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Permanent Secretary may require medical examination of proposed teacher
section.content: The Permanent Secretary may, before registering a person as a teacher or issuing a permit to teach in respect of any person, require such person to undergo a medical examination.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Application for registration as a teacher
section.leadIn: An application for registration as a teacher shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made to the Permanent Secretary in the specified form; and (Amended 8 of 2001 s. 4; 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by the documents specified in such form.

subsection.leadIn: On receiving an application in accordance with section 44, the Permanent Secretary shall make such inquiry as he considers necessary and shall determine the application— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by registering the applicant as a teacher; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by refusing under section 46 to register the applicant as a teacher.

subsection.content: On registering an applicant as a teacher under subsection (1), the Permanent Secretary shall issue to the applicant a certificate of registration in the specified form. (Amended 8 of 2001 s. 4; 3 of 2003 s. 11)

section.name: s46
section.heading: Grounds for refusal to register teacher
section.leadIn: The Permanent Secretary may refuse to register an applicant as a teacher if it appears to him that the applicant— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is not a fit and proper person to be a teacher;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has been convicted of an offence punishable with imprisonment;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is a person in respect of whom a permit to teach has previously been cancelled;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is medically unfit;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: does not possess the prescribed qualifications;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: has attained the age of 70 years; or

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: in making or in connexion with any application—

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for registration as a manager or a teacher; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: to employ a person as a permitted teacher in a school,

paragraph.continued: has made any statement or furnished any information which is false in any material particular or by reason of the omission of any material particular.

section.name: s47
section.heading: Grounds for cancellation of registration of teacher
section.leadIn: The Permanent Secretary may cancel the registration of a teacher— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on any ground specified in section 46 which applies to the teacher, whether or not such ground existed at the time when he was registered as a teacher;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if it appears to the Permanent Secretary that the teacher is incompetent;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the teacher has contravened any provision of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if it appears to the Permanent Secretary that the teacher has behaved in any manner which, in the opinion of the Permanent Secretary, constitutes professional misconduct; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: if it appears to the Permanent Secretary that the teacher has behaved in any manner which, in the opinion of the Permanent Secretary, is prejudicial to the maintenance of good order and discipline in the school in which the teacher teaches.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Circumstances in which application to employ permitted teacher may be made
section.content: An application to employ a person as a permitted teacher in a school may only be made if the applicant is of the opinion that no suitable registered teacher is available for employment as a teacher in the school.

subsection.leadIn: An application to employ a person as a permitted teacher in a school shall be made to the Permanent Secretary— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a school which is registered or provisionally registered, by the management authority; or (Amended 27 of 2004 s. 70)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a proposed school, by the applicant for registration of the school.

subsection.content: An application to employ a person as a permitted teacher in a school shall be made in the specified form. (Amended 8 of 2001 s. 4)

subsection.leadIn: On receiving an application in accordance with section 49, the Permanent Secretary shall make such inquiry as he considers necessary and shall determine the application— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by issuing to the management authority of the school concerned a permit in the specified form; or (Amended 8 of 2001 s. 4; 27 of 2004 s. 70)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by refusing under section 51 to issue such a permit.

subsection.content: A permit to teach issued under subsection (1) shall specify the school in which the permitted teacher may be employed, and may impose such other conditions in respect of the employment of the permitted teacher in the school as the Permanent Secretary thinks fit.
The Permanent Secretary shall, if he issues a permit to teach under subsection (1), also issue a copy of the permit to the permitted teacher.

section.name: s51
section.heading: Grounds for refusal to issue permit to teach

subsection.leadIn: The Permanent Secretary may refuse to issue a permit to teach under section 50(1) in respect of any person— (Amended 21 of 2000 s. 3; 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if in the opinion of the Permanent Secretary a suitable registered teacher is available for employment as a teacher in the school concerned;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: if the person in respect of whom the application is made does not possess the prescribed qualification; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: if it appears to the Permanent Secretary that the applicant or the person in respect of whom the application is made has, in making or in connexion with any application— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for registration as a manager or a teacher; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: to employ a person as a permitted teacher in a school,

paragraph.continued: made any statement or furnished any information which is false in any material particular or by reason of the omission of any material particular.

subsection.content: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (1), the Permanent Secretary shall refuse to issue a permit to teach for the employment of a person as a permitted teacher in an aided school if the person is prohibited from being so employed by virtue of section 58A. (Added 21 of 2000 s. 3)

section.name: s52
section.heading: Grounds for cancellation of permit to teach

subsection.leadIn: The Permanent Secretary may cancel a permit to teach— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on any ground specified in section 51(1)(b), (c) or (d) on which he would have been entitled to refuse to issue a permit to teach, whether or not such ground existed at the time when the permit was issued; or (Amended 21 of 2000 s. 4)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on any ground specified in section 47(b), (c), (d) or (e) which applies to the permitted teacher.

subsection.leadIn: A permit to teach shall be deemed to be cancelled—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the permitted teacher ceases to be employed in the school specified in the permit; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the registration or provisional registration of the school specified in the permit is cancelled.

subsection.content: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (1) or (2), the Permanent Secretary shall cancel the permit to teach of a permitted teacher who is employed to teach in an aided school if the teacher is prohibited from continuing to be so employed by virtue of section 58A. (Added 21 of 2000 s. 4. Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

section.name: s53
section.heading: Approval of first principal of school

subsection.content: Within 1 month after the registration or provisional registration of a school, the management committee or incorporated management committee (as may be appropriate) shall recommend for the approval of the Permanent Secretary a teacher of the school to be the principal. (Amended 27 of 2004 s. 19)
Subject to section 54, the Permanent Secretary shall approve as the principal of the school the teacher who is recommended under subsection (1).

section.name: s54
section.heading: Grounds for refusal to approve principal

subsection.content: The Permanent Secretary may refuse to approve a teacher as the principal of a school if the Permanent Secretary is not satisfied that the teacher is a fit and proper person or, in the case of a school providing nursery or kindergarten education, appropriately qualified to be the principal of the school. (Amended 61 of 1982 s. 5; 38 of 1983 s. 3; 21 of 2000 s. 5)

Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (1), the Permanent Secretary shall refuse to approve a teacher as the principal of an aided school if the teacher is prohibited from being employed as the principal of the school by virtue of section 58A. (Added 21 of 2000 s. 5)

section.name: s55
section.heading: Tenure of office of principal
section.leadIn: The principal of a school shall hold office until—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he ceases to be registered as a teacher, or to be permitted to teach as a permitted teacher in the school;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he resigns;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Permanent Secretary withdraws his approval of the principal under section 56; or (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Permanent Secretary approves another teacher of the school as the principal under section 57(2). (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

section.name: s56
section.heading: Grounds for withdrawal of approval of principal

subsection.leadIn: The Permanent Secretary may withdraw his approval of the principal of a school if it appears to the Permanent Secretary that the principal— (Amended 21 of 2000 s. 6; Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is no longer a fit and proper person to be the principal;

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: in the case of a school providing nursery or kindergarten education, is not appropriately qualified to be the principal; (Added 61 of 1982 s. 6. Amended 38 of 1983 s. 4)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not performing the duties of the principal satisfactorily;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has ceased to perform the duties of the principal; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is no longer acceptable as such to the majority of the managers of the school. (Amended 27 of 2004 s. 20)

subsection.content: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (1), the Permanent Secretary shall withdraw his approval of the principal of an aided school if the principal is prohibited from continuing to be employed as the principal of the school by virtue of section 58A. (Added 21 of 2000 s. 6. Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

subsection.leadIn: If in the case of any school—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Permanent Secretary refuses under section 54 to approve a teacher who has been recommended to be the principal;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the principal ceased under section 55 to hold office;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the principal ceases to perform the duties of the principal; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the principal is no longer acceptable as such to the majority of the managers of the school, (Amended 27 of 2004 s. 21)

subsection.continued: the management committee or incorporated management committee (as may be appropriate) of the school shall within 1 month recommend for the approval of the Permanent Secretary another teacher of the school to be the principal. (Amended 27 of 2004 s. 21)

subsection.content: Subject to section 54, the Permanent Secretary shall approve as the principal of the school the teacher who is recommended under subsection (1).

section.name: s57A
section.heading: Selection of principal of IMC school

subsection.content: This section applies to an IMC school.
Before recommending any person under section 57, the incorporated management committee shall appoint a principal selection committee.

subsection.leadIn: A principal selection committee shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be accountable to the incorporated management committee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: be composed of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: representatives of the sponsoring body of the school;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: managers of the school acting as representatives of the incorporated management committee; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: (where applicable) such other persons as may be provided for in the constitution of the incorporated management committee.

subsection.content: A principal selection committee shall select in an open, fair and transparent manner a suitable person for recommendation under section 57 from candidates nominated in an open, fair and transparent manner by the sponsoring body or the incorporated management committee of the school or both as may be provided for in the constitution of the incorporated management committee.
The incorporated management committee of a school shall recommend under section 57 the person selected by the principal selection committee.

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (2), (3), (4) and (5) do not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the sponsoring body of the school makes a request of the incorporated management committee under section 40AG(1)(a)(ii); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Permanent Secretary exempts, on an application by the sponsoring body or incorporated management committee and upon good cause being shown to his satisfaction, the committee from those subsections in respect of any principal of the school.

subsection.content: The principal of a school shall, subject to the directions of the management committee or incorporated management committee (as may be appropriate), be responsible for the teaching and discipline of the school and for such purposes shall have authority over the teachers and pupils of the school. (Amended 27 of 2004 s. 23)

The Permanent Secretary may address the principal of a school on any matter relating to the teaching and discipline in the school, and in such case the principal shall conduct correspondence directly with the Permanent Secretary. (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

section.name: s58AA
section.heading: Performance of functions of principal by candidate

subsection.leadIn: A teacher who is not a principal of a school and who has been recommended under section 53(1) or 57(1) for approval to be the principal of the school may, as long as he is a registered teacher or permitted teacher, perform the functions of the principal until the recommendation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is approved under section 53(2) or 57(2), as the case may be; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is refused under section 54.

subsection.content: A teacher performing any function of a principal under subsection (1) shall be regarded for the purposes of this Ordinance (except sections 40AL(2)(b), 55 and 56) as the principal. (Amended 27 of 2004 s. 24)

part.crossHeading: Teachers and principals of aided schools

section.name: s58A
section.heading: Prohibition against employment of persons of specified age as teachers or principals of aided schools

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a person shall not be employed as a teacher or the principal of an aided school if he—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: would commence such employment after the commencement of this section; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: would be aged 60 years or more at the commencement of such employment;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person employed as a teacher or the principal of an aided school shall not continue to be so employed for a school year or any part thereof if he has attained the age of 60 years or more before the commencement of the school year, except in accordance with a permission under section 58B(2)(a).

subsection.leadIn: Nothing in subsection (1) applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the employment of a person as a temporary replacement of a teacher of an aided school for any period during which that teacher is unable for any reason to perform his duties as a teacher of the school; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the employment of a person as a teacher of an aided school where the person fills a post that is not within the teaching staff establishment of the school approved by the Permanent Secretary from time to time. (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

section.name: s58B
section.heading: Application for permission to continue to employ serving teachers or principals of aided schools

subsection.leadIn: The management committee or incorporated management committee (as may be appropriate) of an aided school may make an application in writing to the Permanent Secretary for permission to continue to employ a teacher of the school as a teacher or the principal of the school as the principal, in either case for a period of not more than one school year, where the teacher or principal— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11; 27 of 2004 s. 25)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is otherwise prohibited from continuing to be so employed by virtue of section 58A(1)(b); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is serving as a teacher or the principal of the school (as the case may be) immediately before the commencement of the period concerned.

subsection.leadIn: As soon as reasonably practicable after the receipt of an application under subsection (1), the Permanent Secretary shall, subject to subsection (3), determine the application by— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: issuing to the management committee or incorporated management committee (as may be appropriate) of the school concerned permission in writing to continue to employ the teacher or principal for the period specified in the application or for such other period (being not more than one school year) as the Permanent Secretary thinks fit; or (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11; 27 of 2004 s. 25)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refusing to issue such permission.

subsection.content: The maximum aggregate period for which permission may be issued under subsection (2)(a) in respect of the teacher or principal shall be 5 consecutive school years.

def.name: SchoolYear
def.heading: Meaning of school year
def.content: For the purposes of sections 58A and 58B, school year (學年) means any period after the first anniversary of the commencement of this section that begins on the first day of September in a year and ends on the last day of August in the following year.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, the Chief Executive shall by notice published in the Gazette appoint—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a panel of persons (the Appeal Boards Panel) whom he considers suitable for appointment as members of an Appeal Board;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a member of the Appeal Boards Panel as the Chairman of the Appeal Boards Panel;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: one or more members of the Appeal Boards Panel as Deputy Chairmen of the Appeal Boards Panel as he thinks fit; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a person to be the secretary of the Appeal Boards Panel.

subsection.content: A person appointed under subsection (1) shall hold office for such period as may be specified in such notice and may resign his office at any time by notice in writing to the Chief Executive.
The Appeal Boards Panel may, subject to any other provision in this Part, regulate its own procedure and the procedure for appeals and make standing orders for those purposes.
An Appeal Board may at its request be assisted in the conduct of an appeal by a legally qualified person appointed by the Secretary for Justice to act as legal advisor.

subsection.def: In this section, legally qualified (具有法律專業資格) means qualified to practise as a legal practitioner in Hong Kong.

editorialNote.content: For the saving provisions relating to the amendments made by section 5 of the Education (Miscellaneous Amendments) Ordinance 2004 (1 of 2004), see 1 of 2004 s. 14.

section.name: s60
section.heading: Permanent Secretary to serve notice of decision on person adversely affected

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), if the Permanent Secretary has made a decision by exercising any power conferred on him under a provision specified in the First Column of the Table contained in this section, he shall serve notice in writing of his decision on the persons specified in relation thereto in the Second Column of the Table, stating the grounds for his decision, and shall supply to the person a copy of this Part.
Table

subsection.leadIn: If an order is made under section 9(3) or (5) exempting a school from section 10, subsection (1) of this section shall not apply in respect of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a refusal by the Permanent Secretary under section 30(1) to register any person as a manager of the school;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the cancellation by the Permanent Secretary under section 31(1) of the registration of any manager of the school;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a refusal by the Permanent Secretary under section 35(1) to approve any person as the supervisor of the school;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the withdrawal by the Permanent Secretary under section 37 of the approval of any supervisor of the school;

paragraph.name: e
f
g
paragraph.content: a refusal by the Permanent Secretary under section 54(1) to approve any teacher as the principal of the school; or

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the withdrawal under section 56(1) of the approval of any principal of the school.

section.name: s61
section.heading: Right of appeal to Appeal Board

subsection.content: A person on whom a notice is served under section 60(1) may, within 21 days after the service of the notice, appeal to an Appeal Board against the decision of the Permanent Secretary referred to in the notice, by delivering in duplicate to the secretary of the Appeal Boards Panel a notice of appeal in accordance with subsection (2). (Amended 1 of 2004 s. 6)

subsection.leadIn: Every notice of appeal shall be in writing and shall specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the decision of the Permanent Secretary in respect of which the appeal is brought; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the grounds on which the appeal is brought.

subsection.leadIn: On receiving a notice of appeal in accordance with section 61, the secretary of the Appeal Boards Panel shall— (Amended 1 of 2004 s. 7)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: forthwith forward one copy of the notice of appeal to the Permanent Secretary;

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: appoint an Appeal Board in accordance with subsections (1A) and (1B) to hear and determine the appeal; (Added 1 of 2004 s. 7)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fix a time and place for the hearing of the appeal by the Appeal Board; and (Amended 1 of 2004 s. 7)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: give the appellant and the Permanent Secretary not less than 14 days’ notice of the time and place fixed for the hearing of the appeal. (Amended E.R. 1 of 2021)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: An Appeal Board shall consist of 5 members of the Appeal Boards Panel, who shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Chairman or a Deputy Chairman of the Appeal Boards Panel; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 4 other members of the Appeal Boards Panel. (Added 1 of 2004 s. 7)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: Where an Appeal Board hears or determines any appeal concerning the registration of a teacher or the cancellation of the registration of a teacher, at least 3 of its members must be registered teachers. (Added 1 of 2004 s. 7)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.content: If a member of an Appeal Board is precluded by illness, incapacity, absence from Hong Kong or any other cause from exercising his functions, the secretary of the Appeal Boards Panel may appoint any other person from the Panel to act in the place of that member. (Added 1 of 2004 s. 7)

On receiving a copy of a notice of appeal under subsection (1), the Permanent Secretary shall forthwith forward to the secretary of the Appeal Boards Panel a copy of the notice which has been served on the appellant under section 60(1). (Amended 1 of 2004 s. 7)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: The Chairman or a Deputy Chairman of the Appeal Boards Panel appointed as a member to an Appeal Board shall preside at the hearing of an appeal by the Appeal Board. (Added 1 of 2004 s. 7)

At the hearing of an appeal, the appellant or his authorized representative, and the Permanent Secretary or any person appointed by him for such purpose, shall be entitled to be present and to be heard on the appeal.
The hearing of an appeal may at the discretion of the Appeal Board be open to the public or in camera, or partly open to the public and partly in camera. (Amended 1 of 2004 s. 7)

The hearing of an appeal may, with the consent of the appellant and the Permanent Secretary, be continued notwithstanding a change in the membership of the Appeal Board by virtue of subsection (1C). (Replaced 1 of 2004 s. 7)

An Appeal Board may hear and determine an appeal in the absence of the appellant or the Permanent Secretary if due notice of the hearing of the appeal has been given to both of the parties. (Amended 1 of 2004 s. 7)
The onus of proving that the grounds stated by the Permanent Secretary under section 60(1) for his decision are not correct, or do not justify the decision, shall be upon the appellant.

Except with the permission of the Appeal Board, neither the appellant nor the Permanent Secretary may rely at the hearing of an appeal on any grounds other than those stated by the Permanent Secretary in the notice served on the appellant under section 60(1), and those specified by the appellant in the notice of appeal. (Amended 1 of 2004 s. 7)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of hearing an appeal, an Appeal Board may— (Amended 1 of 2004 s. 8)

paragraph.name: a
