paragraph.content: subject to subsection (4), hear and examine witnesses on oath;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (4), summon any person to attend any hearing of the Appeal Board to give evidence or produce any document or other thing in his possession and examine him as a witness or require him to produce any document or other thing in his possession;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: order an inspection of any premises;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: enter and view any premises.

subsection.content: A summons under subsection (1) shall be in such form as the chairman of the Appeal Boards Panel shall direct and shall be signed by the Chairman (or a Deputy Chairman if the Chairman is absent) and the secretary of the Appeal Boards Panel.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), any person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: being summoned under subsection (1) to attend any hearing of an Appeal Board to give evidence or to produce any document or other thing in his possession, refuses or neglects to do so; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: being examined under subsection (1) as a witness by or before an Appeal Board, refuses or neglects to answer any question put to him by or with the concurrence of the Appeal Board, or to produce any document or other thing in his possession when required to do so,

subsection.continued: shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 3 months. (Amended 47 of 1990 s. 5; L.N. 205 of 2000)

subsection.content: Every person who appears as a witness before an Appeal Board shall be entitled to the same privileges in respect of the giving of evidence and the production of any document and other thing as he would be entitled to if appearing as a witness in civil proceedings before the Court of First Instance. (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: Any person who—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: wilfully disrupts the proceedings of an Appeal Board,

subsection.continued: shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 3 months. (Amended 47 of 1990 s. 5; L.N. 205 of 2000)

subsection.content: On the hearing of an appeal, an Appeal Board may confirm, reverse or vary the decision of the Permanent Secretary appealed against, and shall state its reasons for its decision.

The secretary of the Appeal Boards Panel shall serve on the appellant and the Permanent Secretary notice in writing of the decision of the Appeal Board together with the reasons of the Appeal Board for its decision.

section.name: s65
section.heading: Further right of appeal to Chief Executive in Council
section.content: The Permanent Secretary or the appellant may within 14 days after being served under section 64(2) with a notice of the decision of an Appeal Board appeal by way of petition to the Chief Executive in Council.

section.name: s66
section.heading: Permission to operate school or to act etc. pending appeal

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding any other provision in this Ordinance, the Permanent Secretary may on such conditions, if any, as he thinks fit— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by notice in writing to the management authority permit a school to continue to operate after the registration or provisional registration of the school has been cancelled under section 22(1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by notice in writing to a manager of a school permit him to continue to be a manager of the school after his registration as a manager of the school has been cancelled under section 31(1); (Amended 42 of 1993 s. 20)

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: by notice in writing to an incorporated management committee permit an amendment to the constitution of the committee to take effect after he has objected to the amendment under section 40AY(4); (Added 27 of 2004 s. 27)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by notice in writing to a registered teacher permit him to continue to teach after his registration as a teacher has been cancelled under section 47; (Amended 21 of 2000 s. 9)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by notice in writing to the management authority of a school permit a permitted teacher to continue to be employed as a teacher in the school after the permit to teach issued in respect of such teacher has been cancelled under section 52(1); or (Amended 21 of 2000 s. 9)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: by notice in writing to the management authority of an aided school permit a person in respect of whom permission has been refused under section 58B(2)(b) to continue to be employed as a teacher or the principal of the school. (Added 21 of 2000 s. 9. Amended 27 of 2004 s. 70)

subsection.leadIn: Any permission given by the Permanent Secretary under subsection (1) shall remain in force— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: until—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the expiry of the time specified in section 61(1) for the bringing of an appeal to an Appeal Board against the decision of the Permanent Secretary; and (Amended 1 of 2004 s. 11)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the determination of any appeal brought under section 61 to an Appeal Board against the decision of the Permanent Secretary; and (Amended 1 of 2004 s. 11)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if an appeal is brought under section 61 to an Appeal Board against the decision of the Permanent Secretary, until— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11; 1 of 2004 s. 11)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the expiry of the time specified in section 65 for the bringing of a further appeal to the Chief Executive in Council against the decision of an Appeal Board; and (Amended 1 of 2004 s. 11)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the determination of any further appeal brought under section 65 to the Chief Executive in Council against the decision of an Appeal Board; and (Amended 55 of 2000 s. 3; 1 of 2004 s. 11)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in special circumstances, until such later date as the Permanent Secretary may specify. (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

part.name: P6
part.heading: Additional Provisions as to Registration, Approvals and Permits to Teach

section.name: s67
section.heading: Permanent Secretary may require interview or further information
section.leadIn: If an application is made for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registration of a school;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the registration as a manager or a teacher; or (Amended L.N. 28 of 2013)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the employment of a person as a permitted teacher in a school, (Amended L.N. 28 of 2013)

section.continued: the Permanent Secretary may require the applicant or the proposed permitted teacher— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: to attend an interview with such person as the Permanent Secretary may specify; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: to make any declaration or to supply any further particulars that the Permanent Secretary considers necessary in connexion with the application.

section.name: s71
section.heading: Return of invalid certificates and permits
section.leadIn: Notwithstanding any other provision in this Ordinance, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a school ceases to be registered or provisionally registered;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person ceases to be registered as a manager or a teacher; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a person ceases to be a permitted teacher,

section.continued: every person who has in his possession any certificate or copy of a certificate relating to such registration, provisional registration or, in the case referred to in paragraph (d), the permit to teach or a copy of the permit to teach issued in respect of the permitted teacher, shall within one month after being required to do so by the Permanent Secretary deliver such document to the Permanent Secretary.

section.name: s72
section.heading: Restrictions on entry into school premises

subsection.leadIn: If the registration or provisional registration of a school has been cancelled under section 22, no person who has at any time been a manager, teacher or pupil of the school shall enter or remain in any premises— (Amended 42 of 1993 s. 24)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in which the school was operated; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which are being used for the purposes of a school,

subsection.continued: without the permission in writing of the Permanent Secretary.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall, without the permission in writing of the Permanent Secretary, enter or remain in any school— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if at any time—

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: he has been refused registration as a manager or a teacher, or having been so registered has had his registration cancelled;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a permit to teach has been refused in respect of such person;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: he has been a permitted teacher in respect of whom a permit to teach has been cancelled; or

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: he has been refused approval as the supervisor or principal of a school, or having been so approved has had such approval withdrawn. (Amended E.R. 1 of 2021)

subsection.content: The Permanent Secretary may attach to any permission given under this section such conditions as he thinks fit.

section.name: s72A
section.heading: Sponsoring body’s views take priority over management committee’s

subsection.content: Where the Permanent Secretary has approved a sponsoring body for a particular school without IMC, in exercising his powers under sections 30(2), 31(2A), 37(d), 38(2) and 38A(2) in respect of such a school, the Permanent Secretary shall, in addition to taking account of the views of the management committee, also take account of the views of the sponsoring body, but nothing in this section shall impose a duty on the Permanent Secretary to seek the views of the sponsoring body. (Amended 27 of 2004 s. 28; 17 of 2018 s. 86)

The views of the sponsoring body shall be expressed by resolution of its board, or other governing body as established by its constitution, and a copy of the resolution shall be sent to the Permanent Secretary.

A sponsoring body may express its views on a matter relating to the provisions referred to in subsection (1) whether or not the management committee of the school has expressed its views on the matter and, where the management committee has expressed its views on the matter, the views of the sponsoring body shall prevail.

part.name: P7
part.heading: Power of Permanent Secretary to Order Attendance at a Primary or Secondary School

section.name: s73
section.heading: Interpretation of Part VII
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: attendance order (入學令) means an order made under section 74;
parent (家長) in relation to any child to whom section 74 applies includes a guardian and the person having the actual custody of the child.

section.name: s74
section.heading: Power of Permanent Secretary to order attendance at primary school or secondary school

subsection.content: Where it appears to the Permanent Secretary that a child is not attending primary school or secondary school without any reasonable excuse, the Permanent Secretary may, after making such inquiries as he considers necessary, serve upon a parent of the child an attendance order in the specified form requiring him to cause the child to attend regularly as a pupil the primary school or secondary school named in the attendance order. (Amended 34 of 1979 s. 5; 47 of 1990 s. 6; 8 of 2001 s. 4)

subsection.leadIn: The Permanent Secretary may at any time, by notice in writing served upon a parent of the child to whom an attendance order relates— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: vary the order by substituting another primary school or secondary school for that named in the order; (Amended 34 of 1979 s. 5)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: otherwise vary or withdraw the order,

subsection.continued: and any variation of an attendance order shall take effect on the expiry of the period of 14 days after the date of service of the notice in writing.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: The Permanent Secretary may at any time, by notice in writing served upon the management committee or incorporated management committee (as may be appropriate) of a primary school or secondary school named in an attendance order, require the committee to admit to that school as a pupil the child to whom the attendance order relates. (Added 47 of 1990 s. 6. Amended 27 of 2004 s. 29)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.content: No person shall, without the permission in writing of the Permanent Secretary, expel from a primary school or secondary school named in an attendance order the child to whom the attendance order relates and who has been admitted to that school as a pupil in accordance with that order. (Added 47 of 1990 s. 6)

subsection.leadIn: This section shall—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: not apply to a child— (Amended 47 of 1990 s. 6)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: who has completed Form III of secondary education and whose parent can produce evidence to that effect to the satisfaction of the Permanent Secretary;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: who is a registered apprentice under the Apprenticeship Ordinance (Cap. 47); or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: who is attending regularly, or is an inmate of, an institution (other than a school) which is regarded by the Permanent Secretary as suitable for the child. (Added 34 of 1979 s. 5)

section.name: s74A
section.heading: Appeals

editorialNote.content: (Sections 75, 76 and 77 were repealed and section 74A was substituted by 8 of 2001. For related transitional provisions, see 8 of 2001 s. 16.)

section.leadIn: A parent aggrieved by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an attendance order; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any variation of an attendance order under section 74(2),

section.continued: made in respect of him may appeal to the Administrative Appeals Board.

section.name: s78
section.heading: Enforcement of order
section.leadIn: Any parent who without reasonable excuse fails to comply with an attendance order (as the same may be varied from time to time) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 3 months: (Amended 47 of 1990 s. 8; L.N. 205 of 2000)
section.proviso: Provided that if an appeal is made against an attendance order or a variation of an attendance order under section 74A, no offence shall be committed by reason of a failure to comply with the attendance order or the attendance order as varied, as the case may be, until the appeal has been disposed of, withdrawn or abandoned. (Amended 8 of 2001 s. 9)

section.name: s79
section.heading: Appointment of inspectors
section.leadIn: The Chief Executive may by notice in the Gazette appoint by name or office— (Amended 55 of 2000 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any officer of the Education Bureau to be an inspector of schools; (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 9; L.N. 130 of 2007)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any Government medical officer to be a medical officer of schools; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any health inspector to be a health inspector of schools.

section.name: s80
section.heading: Inspection of schools
section.content: The Permanent Secretary and any inspector of schools may inspect any school for the purposes of ascertaining whether this Ordinance is being complied with and whether the school is being conducted satisfactorily.

section.name: s81
section.heading: Powers of inspectors
section.leadIn: The Permanent Secretary and any inspector of schools may, for the purposes of section 80— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at all reasonable times enter the premises of any school;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: enter any premises in which he has reason to suspect that an offence against this Ordinance has been or is being committed;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: require any manager or teacher of a school to produce any book, document or other article relating to the management of the school, or to the teaching in or any other activity of the school, or to furnish any information relating to such management, teaching or activity;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: remove for further examination any book, document or other article which he has reason to suspect is evidence of the commission of an offence against this Ordinance, or for the cancellation of the registration of any school, manager or teacher, or for the cancellation of the provisional registration of any school, or for the cancellation of any permit to teach; and (Amended 42 of 1993 s. 26)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: do such other things as are necessary for the inspection of a school.

section.name: s81A
section.heading: Inspection of premises in the case of unregistered schools

subsection.content: The Permanent Secretary and any inspector of schools may enter and inspect any premises which the Permanent Secretary has reason to suspect are being used for the purposes of a school which is not registered or provisionally registered.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: The Permanent Secretary and any inspector of schools may, for the purposes of this section— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require any person apparently in charge of the premises to produce any book, document or other article relating to the management of any business being carried on on the premises or to furnish any information relating to such management or business; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: remove for further examination any book, document or other article which he has reason to suspect is evidence of the commission of an offence against this Ordinance. (Added 42 of 1993 s. 27)

subsection.leadIn: If the Permanent Secretary or any inspector of schools— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is obstructed by any person while he is carrying out, or attempting to carry out, an inspection of any premises referred to in subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has reason to suspect that he is likely to be so obstructed in carrying out, or attempting to carry out, such an inspection,

subsection.continued: the Permanent Secretary or inspector, as the case may be, may apply to a magistrate under subsection (3) for a warrant to enter and inspect those premises.

subsection.content: A magistrate may issue a warrant authorizing the Permanent Secretary or any inspector of schools, with such assistance from members of the Fire Services Department as may be necessary, to enter and inspect any premises referred to in subsection (1) if he is satisfied by information on oath that there are reasonable grounds for suspecting that those premises are being used for the purposes of a school which is not registered or provisionally registered. (Amended 42 of 1993 s. 27)

subsection.leadIn: A warrant issued by a magistrate under subsection (3) may authorize the Permanent Secretary or any inspector of schools, together with any members of the Fire Services Department, to— (Amended 42 of 1993 s. 27; 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter those premises, if necessary by force;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: remain on those premises for such time or times as may be specified in the warrant;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: re-enter those premises from time to time or on such day or days as may be specified in the warrant.

section.name: s81B
section.heading: Power to request personal particulars
section.leadIn: Where the Permanent Secretary or any inspector of schools enters any premises under section 81(b) or 81A(1) or (3), he may, for the purposes for which he enters the premises, require any person found in the premises whom he reasonably believes to be guilty of an offence under this Ordinance to— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: furnish to him for his inspection the person’s proof of identity; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: furnish to him the person’s residential address and contact telephone number.

section.name: s82
section.heading: Power of Permanent Secretary to direct remedial measures

subsection.leadIn: The Permanent Secretary may, if it appears to him that— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a school is not being managed satisfactorily;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the education of the pupils of a school is not being promoted in a proper manner; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any provision of this Ordinance is being or has been contravened in respect of a school,

subsection.continued: by notice in writing give such directions as he thinks necessary in order that the school will be operated satisfactorily, or that the education of the pupils of the school will be promoted in a proper manner, or that such provision of this Ordinance will be complied within in respect of the school.

subsection.leadIn: Any notice under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may be served on the management authority and every manager of the school concerned; and (Amended 27 of 2004 s. 30)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may specify a period of time within which the directions shall be complied with.

section.name: s83
section.heading: Powers of Permanent Secretary to close school or give directions in cases of danger or misconduct

subsection.leadIn: The Permanent Secretary may, if it appears to him that— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is any danger or risk of danger to persons in any school premises;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the conduct of the managers, teachers or pupils of a school is or has been unsatisfactory; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any provision of this Ordinance is being or has been contravened in respect of a school,

subsection.continued: by order in writing served on the management authority of the school— (Amended 27 of 2004 s. 31)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: suspend the operation of the school in the school premises, or any part of the school premises, for such period as he thinks fit or until further notice; (Amended 47 of 1980 s. 2)

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: prohibit the use of any place for the purposes of a school for such period as he thinks fit or until further notice; or

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: give such directions and make such requirements as he thinks necessary.

subsection.name: 1AA
subsection.content: If it appears to the Permanent Secretary that the circumstances mentioned in subsection (1)(a) or (c) exist and the Permanent Secretary serves an order under subsection (1) accordingly, he shall serve a copy of the order on each manager of the school. (Added 27 of 2004 s. 31)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Notwithstanding subsection (1), if it appears to the Permanent Secretary that there is any immediate danger or immediate risk of danger to persons in any school premises due to bad weather, he may, by making public announcements on radio, television or newspapers or by such other means as he thinks fit, suspend the operation of the school in the school premises. (Added 8 of 2001 s. 11)

subsection.leadIn: The Permanent Secretary may, if any direction or requirement given or made by him under subsection (1)(iii) has not been complied with to his satisfaction, by order in writing— (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: suspend the operation of the school in the school premises, or any part of the school premises; or (Amended 47 of 1980 s. 2)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prohibit the use of any place for the purposes of the school,

subsection.continued: until the direction or requirement is so complied with.

subsection.content: The Permanent Secretary may by order in writing close any premises of a school which is not registered or provisionally registered.

The Permanent Secretary may, if a school is operated in any premises which are not specified in the certificate of registration or provisional registration of the school, by order in writing close such premises.
An order made by the Permanent Secretary under subsection (1)(i) or (ii) or subsection (2), (3) or (4) shall be published in the Gazette.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall enter or remain in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any premises or any part of any premises in which the operation of a school has been suspended under subsection (1), (1A) or (2); (Replaced 47 of 1980 s. 2. Amended 8 of 2001 s. 11)

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: any premises or any part of any premises which have been closed under subsection (3) or (4); or (Added 47 of 1980 s. 2)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any place the use of which for the purposes of a school has been prohibited by the Permanent Secretary under subsection (1) or (2),

subsection.continued: unless—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: he is a public officer acting in the course of his duty; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the Permanent Secretary has given him permission in writing to do so. (Amended L.N. 162 of 1993)

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may make regulations providing for— (Amended 55 of 2000 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the structure, hygiene and sanitation of school premises;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the precautions to be taken against fire or other peril likely to endanger the lives or health of pupils, and the authorizing of officers of the Fire Services Department to enter and inspect school premises and premises in which schools are situated and premises in the neighbourhood of schools; (Amended E.R. 1 of 2021)

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: the operation of schools in premises which, by reason of the loading for which they were designed and constructed, are unsuitable for the purposes of a school;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the health inspection of schools and school premises and standards of hygiene to be maintained by schools;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the medical examination of teachers and pupils and standards of medical fitness for teachers;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the temporary exclusion from any school of any teacher or pupil, and any other measures necessary or desirable to preserve the health and well-being of teachers and pupils; (Amended L.N. 126 of 1995)

paragraph.name: h
i
paragraph.content: the control of instruction given by schools, including limitations on the subjects taught and the documents which may be upon school premises and which may be used by schools, and the preparation and contents of the syllabus to be used by any school or schools;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: the methods and hours of instruction provided by schools;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: the adequacy, suitability and use of school equipment, school laboratories and school workshops;

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: the control of activities of managers, teachers, pupils and other persons in schools; (Amended 8 of 2001 s. 12)

paragraph.name: la
lb
paragraph.content: the recognition of alumni associations for the purposes of section 40AP; (Added 27 of 2004 s. 32)

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: the control of the dissemination of information, or expression of opinion, of a clearly biased political nature in schools; (Replaced 47 of 1990 s. 10)

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: the control of the use to which school premises may be put and of the persons who may enter school premises;

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.content: school holidays;

paragraph.name: p
paragraph.content: the constitution and duties of management committees and incorporated management committees; (Amended 27 of 2004 s. 32)

paragraph.name: pa
q
paragraph.content: the keeping of school registers, time-tables and books of account;

paragraph.name: r
paragraph.content: the amount and methods of payment of fees and other charges made by schools and the prohibition of any further fees and charges and of any specified fees or charges;

paragraph.name: s
paragraph.content: the amounts of inclusive fees which may be charged by schools and the notification of such fees and the prohibition or restriction of variations from such fees; (Amended 8 of 2001 s. 12)

paragraph.name: sa
paragraph.content: the approval by the Permanent Secretary of any scheme of fee remission, the remission of the whole or any part of inclusive fees and the persons who may grant such remission; (Added 47 of 1980 s. 3)

paragraph.name: t
paragraph.content: general matters of school management;

paragraph.name: u
v
paragraph.content: the giving by management authorities to the Permanent Secretary of such information concerning schools and pupils therein as may be required by the Permanent Secretary; (Amended 27 of 2004 s. 32)

paragraph.name: w
paragraph.content: the qualifications and any continuing education and training of registered teachers and permitted teachers (whether they are principals or not), and the qualifications to be held by teachers of various classes and subjects; (Amended 1 of 2004 s. 12)

paragraph.name: x
paragraph.content: the control of salaries paid to teachers;

paragraph.name: y
paragraph.content: discipline in schools and methods of enforcement of discipline, and the conduct and dress of teachers and pupils;

paragraph.name: z
paragraph.content: anything which is to be prescribed under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: za
paragraph.content: the application of Part V of the Ordinance, subject to such modifications as may be specified in the regulations, to and in relation to any decision made by the Permanent Secretary in exercising any power conferred on him under any regulation, and for matters incidental thereto or consequential thereon; and (Added 47 of 1990 s. 10)

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: the better carrying into effect of the provisions of this Ordinance in relation to any matter as to which it may be convenient to make regulations.

subsection.leadIn: Any regulation made under this section may—

paragraph.name: aa
a
paragraph.content: prohibit the performance of specified acts without the consent of the Permanent Secretary;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: authorize the Permanent Secretary to require or prohibit the performance of specified acts; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: require specified acts to be performed to the satisfaction of the Permanent Secretary.

subsection.content: Regulations made under this section may provide that a contravention thereof shall be an offence punishable on conviction by a fine not exceeding $250,000 and a term of imprisonment not exceeding 2 years. (Amended L.N. 205 of 2000)

subsection.leadIn: The Permanent Secretary may waive—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by circular issued to schools generally or a particular type of schools, wholly or partly the requirement of any regulation in respect of a particular type of schools or teachers;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on application by a supervisor or incorporated management committee of a school and by notice in writing to the applicant, wholly or partly the requirement of any regulation in respect of the school, the applicant or a particular teacher of the school; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: on application by a teacher and by notice in writing to the applicant, wholly or partly the requirement of any regulation in respect of the applicant,

subsection.continued: on such conditions, if any, as he thinks fit. (Replaced 27 of 2004 s. 32)

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of maintaining any provident fund (whether established before or after the commencement of this Ordinance) for the benefit of teachers employed by schools to which grants in aid or subsidies are made by the Government, the Chief Executive in Council may make rules providing for— (Amended 55 of 2000 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the objects and method of control and management and investment of such fund;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the persons or classes of persons who shall be eligible for membership of such fund, and the persons or classes of persons who shall be compulsory contributors to such fund;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: contributions to such fund, and the method of payment;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the method of dealing with any contribution which may be made by the Government to such fund;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the constitution of a reserve fund to meet fluctuations in the value of investments, and for the allocation to a reserve fund of any investment income of the provident fund;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the method of, conditions precedent for, and authority for withdrawals and benefits, and the permissible amount of withdrawals and benefits;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the appointment of any trustees who may be considered necessary, and the powers and duties of the trustees; and

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: generally for the purpose of the maintenance of such fund.

subsection.content: Such sums as may be necessary to meet the contributions payable by the Government to any provident fund in accordance with rules made under subsection (1) shall be met from moneys provided by the Legislative Council.

Subject to any rules made under subsection (1), no contribution or donation to or dividend or interest on a dividend from a provident fund shall be assignable or transferable or liable to be attached, sequestered or levied upon, for or in respect of any debt or claim whatsoever.

If a provident fund member is an undischarged bankrupt, the right or entitlement of the member to any benefits in the fund (whether accrued, accruing or to be accrued) is excluded from the property of the member for the purposes of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6). (Added 4 of 2013 s. 3)
Subsection (4) does not apply in relation to a provident fund member’s bankruptcy that is adjudicated before that subsection comes into operation. (Added 4 of 2013 s. 3)

section.name: s85A
section.heading: Conducting courses on general holidays
section.content: Notwithstanding anything in the General Holidays Ordinance (Cap. 149), a registered school or provisionally registered school may conduct educational courses or give instructions on a general holiday.

section.name: s86
section.heading: Prohibition of issue of degrees or documents resembling degrees
section.leadIn: No person or school shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: award a degree to a person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue any document which could reasonably be taken as signifying the award of a degree to a person.

section.name: s86A
section.heading: Control of false advertising by unregistered schools

subsection.content: No person shall publish any advertisement that alleges that an institution, organization or establishment is registered or provisionally registered as a school under this Ordinance when it was not, at the time of publication, so registered or provisionally registered.

No person shall publish any advertisement with respect to a school that is registered or provisionally registered unless that advertisement includes the registration number assigned by the Permanent Secretary to the school. (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)
Any person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6. (Amended L.N. 205 of 2000; 8 of 2001 s. 13)

Where a person is charged with an offence under subsection (3) relating to an advertisement, it shall be a defence for such person to show that he carries on the business of publishing or arranging for the publication of advertisements, that he received the advertisement for publication in the ordinary course of business and that at the time he published the advertisement he believed upon reasonable grounds that the advertisement related to a school that was registered or provisionally registered.

subsection.def: In this section publish (發布) includes issue, circulate, display, distribute or broadcast.

section.name: s86B
section.heading: Control of false advertising by registered or provisionally registered schools

subsection.leadIn: No owner or manager of a school that is registered or provisionally registered shall publish or cause to be published any advertisement that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: alleges that the school is operating in, or authorized to operate in, premises other than the premises specified in the certificate of registration or provisional registration of the school; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contains any other information otherwise concerning the school which to his knowledge is false or misleading in a material particular. (Amended 8 of 2001 s. 14)

subsection.content: An owner or manager who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6. (Amended L.N. 205 of 2000; 8 of 2001 s. 14)

subsection.def: In this section publish (發布) includes issue, circulate, display, distribute or broadcast.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Without prejudice to the prosecution of any other person, an incorporated management committee is not to be held liable for any offence under this Ordinance. (Added 27 of 2004 s. 33)

subsection.leadIn: Any person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is an owner or a teacher in a school which is not registered or provisionally registered; (Amended 47 of 1990 s. 11; 27 of 2004 s. 33)

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: manages or takes any part in the management of a school which is not registered or provisionally registered; (Added 27 of 2004 s. 33)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is an owner or a manager of a school without IMC which is operated in contravention of section 19(1); (Amended 27 of 2004 s. 33)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: contravenes section 27; (Amended 47 of 1990 s. 11)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: obstructs—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Permanent Secretary or an inspector while the Permanent Secretary or inspector is carrying out, or attempting to carry out, an inspection of a school; (Amended 47 of 1990 s. 11; 3 of 2003 s. 11)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any manager appointed under section 41(1) in the performance of his functions as a manager;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: refuses to produce any book or document or other article or to furnish any information upon being so required under section 81 or 81A(1A), or furnishes information which is false in a material particular and which he knows or reasonably ought to know is false in such particular; (Amended 42 of 1993 s. 29)

paragraph.name: ha
paragraph.content: obstructs the Permanent Secretary or an inspector while the Permanent Secretary or inspector is carrying out, or attempting to carry out, an inspection of premises under section 81A(1) or in accordance with a warrant issued under section 81A(3); (Added 47 of 1990 s. 11. Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: being the supervisor or a manager of a school without IMC, fails to comply with any notice served on him under section 82; (Amended 27 of 2004 s. 33)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: contravenes section 83(6); or

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: in or in connexion with any application under this Ordinance makes any statement or furnishes any information, whether such statement or information be verbal or written, which is false in any material particular and which he knows or reasonably ought to know is false in such particular,

subsection.continued: shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine of $250,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a member of any management committee which contravenes section 38(1) or section 40;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not being the supervisor of a school or a member of the management committee of a school acting under section 40, performs any function of the supervisor of the school;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: not being the principal of a school or empowered under section 58AA(1) to perform the functions of the principal of the school, performs any function of the principal of the school; or (Amended 8 of 2001 s. 15)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: contravenes section 72(1) or (2),

subsection.continued: shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is an owner or manager of a school without IMC which is operated in any name other than its registered name; (Amended 27 of 2004 s. 33)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contravenes section 18(2) or (3);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: contravenes section 19(2);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: contravenes section 42(1) or (2);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: employs or permits any person to teach in a school in contravention of section 42(1) or (2);

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: is a member of a management committee which contravenes section 53(1) or section 57(1);

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: contravenes section 71;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: contravenes section 86; or

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: is an owner or a manager of a school without IMC which contravenes section 86, (Amended 27 of 2004 s. 33)

subsection.continued: shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: Any person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a member of a management committee which contravenes section 74(2A); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contravenes section 74(2B),

subsection.continued: shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 3 months. (Added 47 of 1990 s. 11)

subsection.name: 3B
subsection.leadIn: Any person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: refuses to furnish his proof of identity, residential address or contact telephone number upon being so required under section 81B; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: furnishes a false residential address or contact telephone number upon being required under section 81B to furnish his residential address and contact telephone number,

subsection.continued: shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 3. (Added 8 of 2001 s. 15)

subsection.leadIn: If a manager of a school is charged with an offence by reason of being a member of a management committee which has contravened a provision of this Ordinance specified in subsection (2)(a) or in subsection (3)(g), it shall be a defence to the charge if he proves that— (Amended 27 of 2004 s. 72)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the other members of the management committee contravened such provision without his knowledge or consent; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he took all reasonable steps to prevent the other members of the management committee from contravening such provision.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3)(e) and (f), a person who, not being a registered teacher or permitted teacher, teaches in a school shall be deemed not to contravene section 42(1) if within the previous 6 months—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he has made an application under section 44 and the application has not yet been determined by the Permanent Secretary; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an application has been made under section 48 to employ him as a permitted teacher in the school and the application has not yet been determined by the Permanent Secretary,

subsection.continued: and the application does not form part of a succession of applications made under section 44 or 48 or both. (Added 53 of 1991 s. 2. Amended 3 of 2003 s. 11)

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an IMC school is operated, with the consent or connivance of any manager of the school, in contravention of section 19(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an incorporated management committee, with the consent or connivance of any manager of the school concerned—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: fails to comply with any notice served on it under section 82; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in or in connection with any application under this Ordinance makes any statement or furnishes any information which is false in any material particular and which it knows or reasonably ought to know is false in such particular,

subsection.continued: the manager shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine of $250,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years. (Added 27 of 2004 s. 33)

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an IMC school is operated, with the consent or connivance of any manager of the school, in any name other than its registered name;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an incorporated management committee, with the consent or connivance of any manager of the school concerned, employs or permits any person to teach in a school in contravention of section 42(1) or (2); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an IMC school contravenes section 86 with the consent or connivance of any manager of the school,

subsection.continued: the manager commits an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 2 years. (Added 27 of 2004 s. 33)

subsection.content: If an incorporated management committee contravenes section 74(2A) or (2B) with the consent or connivance of any manager of the school concerned, the manager commits an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 3 months. (Added 27 of 2004 s. 33)

section.name: s88
section.heading: Evidence
section.leadIn: In any prosecution for an offence against this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if it is proved that any equipment, materials or documents of an educational nature or suitable for the purposes of a school were found at any place, it shall be presumed until the contrary is proved that a school was being operated at such place;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if it is proved that any person did any act in connexion with the organization or operation of a school, it shall be presumed until the contrary is proved that such person took part in the management of such school; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if it is proved that any person was in charge of or issued instructions to any person under 21 years of age in any school premises, it shall be presumed until the contrary is proved that the first-mentioned person was teaching in that school.

section.name: s89
section.heading: Liability of landlord and tenant of premises in which school is unlawfully operated

subsection.leadIn: A magistrate may, if satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a school which is not registered or provisionally registered is being operated in any premises; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a school is being operated in any premises which are not specified in the certificate of registration or provisional registration of the school,

subsection.continued: order that a notice in writing of the fact shall be served on the landlord and the tenant of the premises or, if the landlord or tenant is absent or under disability, on his attorney or agent or the rent collector of the landlord or, if the landlord or tenant is a corporation, on the secretary or manager of the corporation.

subsection.content: A magistrate may at the request of any person on whom a notice has been served in accordance with subsection (1), make an order terminating as from the date of the order the tenancy of the premises in which the school is being operated, and on the making of the order the tenancy shall cease and determine for all purposes and any tenant or occupier (other than the landlord) may be treated as a trespasser.
An order under subsection (2) shall be recognized and given effect to in any proceeding in any court.

An order under subsection (2) shall be sufficient authority to any police officer to enter at any time between the hours of 9 a.m. and 5 p.m., by force if necessary, the premises in respect of which the order is made and to give possession of such premises to the landlord or his agent.
The powers conferred by subsection (4) shall be in addition to and not in derogation of any power conferred by any other enactment.

subsection.leadIn: If, after a notice has been served in accordance with subsection (1) on any person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a school which is not registered or provisionally registered is operated in the premises in respect of which the notice was given; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a school is operated in the premises in respect of which the notice was given and such premises are not specified in the certificate of registration or provisional registration of the school,

subsection.continued: the person on whom the notice has been served (and the landlord or the tenant of the premises, if the person on whom such service is made is an attorney, agent, rent collector, secretary or manager for and on behalf of the landlord or tenant) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 2 years, unless he proves to the satisfaction of the magistrate— (Amended L.N. 205 of 2000)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that a request has been made to a magistrate for an order under subsection (2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that he did not know and had no reasonable means of knowing that a school was being so operated on the premises.

subsection.content: A person shall not be guilty of an offence under subsection (6) unless a reasonable time has elapsed, following the service of the notice in accordance with subsection (1) on him, during which a request could have been made to a magistrate for an order under subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: tenancy (租賃) includes any sub-tenancy;
tenant (租客) includes any sub-tenant.

section.name: s90
section.heading: Powers of police officers to enter premises and remove suspected persons

subsection.content: A magistrate may, if satisfied by information on oath that there is reasonable ground for suspecting that section 72 or section 83(6) has been or is being contravened in respect of any premises or place, issue a search warrant authorizing any police officer named therein to enter at any time such premises or place and to search the premises or place and every person found therein and to remove therefrom any person who is or is reasonably suspected to be contravening section 72 or section 83(6).

subsection.leadIn: A police officer may, if he reasonably suspects that section 72 or section 83(6) has been or is being contravened in respect of any premises or place other than a dwellinghouse—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter such premises or place without a warrant, if necessary by force;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: search such premises or place and every person found therein; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: remove from such premises or place any person found therein who is or is reasonably suspected to be contravening section 72 or section 83(6).

subsection.content: Notwithstanding subsections (1) and (2), no person shall be searched under this section except by a person of the same sex.

subsection.leadIn: Where provision is made in this Ordinance for the Chief Executive in Council or a public officer to serve a notice or to cause a notice to be served on a person, it shall be sufficient service if the notice is served— (Amended 55 of 2000 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by causing it to be delivered personally to the person on whom it is to be served;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by causing it to be sent by registered post to the last known address of the person on whom it is to be served;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the person on whom it is to be served is an owner, manager, management authority, principal, teacher or pupil of a school, by causing it to be sent by registered post to any premises specified in the certificate of registration or provisional registration of the school, or any premises in which the school is operated; or (Amended 27 of 2004 s. 70)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the person on whom the notice is to be served is an owner, manager, management authority, principal or teacher of a school, by causing the notice to be posted in a conspicuous place upon or in any premises specified in the certificate of registration or provisional registration of the school, or any premises in which the school is operated. (Amended 27 of 2004 s. 70)

subsection.content: Without prejudice to the provisions of subsection (1), where a notice is to be served on a person under section 89, it shall be sufficient service if it is served by causing the notice to be posted in a conspicuous place upon the premises to which it relates.

section.name: s99
section.heading: Saving
section.content: Notwithstanding the repeal of the Education Ordinance 1952 (Cap. 279, 1964 Ed.), any appointment which has been made under either of the repealed Ordinances and which was in effect immediately prior to the commencement of this Part, shall continue to have effect as if, at the date when it was made, such appointment had been made under this Ordinance.

subsection.content: On the coming into operation* of section 12 of the Education (Amendment) Ordinance 1993 (42 of 1993), all certificates of approval issued to approved managers are null and void.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding the repeal of sections 23 to 26 of this Ordinance by the Education (Amendment) Ordinance 1993 (42 of 1993), where a person’s—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: application was refused; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: approval was withdrawn,

subsection.continued: by the Director of Education under those sections before their repeal, that person shall not, without the permission in writing of the Permanent Secretary, enter or remain in a school, and a person who contravenes this subsection commits an offence and is liable to the penalties provided under section 87(2). (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 10)

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—
section.def: transferee (受讓方) means the incorporated management committee of the relevant school;
transition date (交接日) means the date on which the incorporated management committee of the relevant school is established.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Pre-incorporation contract
section.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: he enters into the contract with the written authority of the management committee or school sponsoring body of the school;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: before he enters into the contract he advises the other party that the incorporated management committee of the school will on the commencement of the transition date become a party to the contract by virtue of this section; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the contract is subsisting immediately before the transition date,

section.continued: the following provisions apply on the commencement of the transition date—

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the committee shall for all purposes substitute for the person as the party to the contract and shall be regarded as having always been the party;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: all rights and liabilities of the person under the contract shall vest in the committee; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the person shall cease to be a party to the contract.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a contract that is—

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: entered into by the supervisor, principal or sponsoring body or a manager of a school (original party) with a person before 1 January 2005;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: entered into for the supply of goods or service by the person for the benefit of the school (but not any other school); and

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: is subsisting immediately before the transition date.

subsection.leadIn: Upon the commencement of the transition date—

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: (if the money paid in consideration of the goods or service is provided by the Government) the transferee shall, with the consent of the person, for all purposes substitute for the original party as the party to the contract, and shall be regarded as having always been the party;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: (if the money paid in consideration of the goods or service is not provided by the Government) the sponsoring body or, where the sponsoring body so decides, the transferee shall, with the consent of the person, for all purposes substitute for the original party as the party to the contract, and shall be regarded as having always been the party.

subsection.leadIn: Where a substitution takes place under subsection (2)—

subparagraph.name: a
b
subparagraph.content: the original party shall cease to be a party to the contract.

subsection.content: Without limiting section 2, a person who is employed to work for a school immediately before the date of the establishment of the incorporated management committee of the school under section 40BN of this Ordinance shall on the commencement of that date be deemed to have been employed by the committee on the same terms and conditions of the employment subsisting immediately before that date.

The incorporated management committee shall, for the purposes of the continuation of the employment referred to in subsection (1), be regarded as having always been the employer of the person since the commencement of the employment and, accordingly, there is no break or interruption in the employment only because of the operation of this section.

subsection.leadIn: The—

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: employment may be terminated; or

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: terms and conditions of the employment may be varied,

subsection.continued: on or after the transition date in the same manner and to the same extent as immediately before that date.

subsection.content: On the transition date, the transferee becomes the owner of all books, accounts, receipts or other document (however compiled, recorded or stored) that are relevant to the functions and powers of the transferee.

All such books, accounts, receipts or other document shall be delivered to the transferee immediately after that date by the person who has the care and custody of them otherwise than pursuant to a lawful authority.
Any person who contravenes subsection (2) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: where this Schedule applies under section 40BR—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.def: transferor (轉讓方) means the school management company of the relevant school;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.def: transferee (受讓方) means the incorporated management committee of the relevant school;

subparagraph.name: iii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where this Schedule applies under section 40CB—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.def: transferor (轉讓方) means the incorporated management committee of the relevant school;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.def: transferee (受讓方) means the school management company of the relevant school;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.def: transition date (交接日) means the date on which the incorporated management committee of the relevant school is dissolved.

subsection.content: All properties, rights, obligations and civil liabilities of the transferor which are subsisting immediately before the transition date shall on the commencement of the transition date vest in the transferee.
For the purposes of the vesting effected by subsection (1), the transferee shall be regarded as having always been the transferor since the establishment of the transferor.
The Stamp Duty Ordinance (Cap. 117) shall not apply to any vesting effected by subsection (1).

The vesting in the transferee of any properties, rights, obligations and liabilities under subsection (1) does not constitute an assignment, transfer, devolution, parting with possession, dealing with or other disposition of such properties, rights, obligations and liabilities for the purposes of any instrument concerning or affecting such properties, rights, obligations and liabilities.

subsection.leadIn: A provision contained in any deed, contract or other document made by the transferor—

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: prohibiting or requiring any consent or approval for the vesting effected by subsection (1); or

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: to the effect that a default shall occur or be deemed to occur, or any right or obligation shall cease, as a result of the vesting effected by subsection (1),

subsection.continued: is deemed to have been waived.

subsection.leadIn: The vesting in the transferee of an interest in land effected by subsection (1) does not—

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: operate as a breach of covenant or condition against alienation;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: give rise to any right of pre-emption, right of forfeiture, right of re-entry, option, damages or other right of action affecting land;

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: invalidate or discharge any contract or security;

subparagraph.name: d
subparagraph.content: operate so as to merge any leasehold interest in the reversion expectant on it; or

subparagraph.name: e
subparagraph.content: extinguish, affect, vary, diminish or postpone any priority of that interest, whether under the Land Registration Ordinance (Cap. 128), at law or in equity.

subsection.leadIn: The transferee shall register or cause to be registered in the Land Registry—

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: where this Schedule applies under section 40BR, a copy of the certificate of incorporation issued to it under section 40BN(1) or 40BX(1) of this Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.leadIn: where this Schedule applies under section 40CB—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a copy of the certificate of incorporation issued to it under the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) or under the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 32) as in force at the time of the issue; (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a copy of the approval granted in respect of the school under section 40CB; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a copy of the text of section 40CB and this Schedule.

subsection.content: A person who is employed to work for a school immediately before the transition date shall on the commencement of the transition date be deemed to have been employed by the transferee on the same terms and conditions of the employment subsisting immediately before that date.

The transferee shall be regarded as having always been the employer of the person since the commencement of the employment referred to in subsection (1) and, accordingly, there is no break or interruption in the employment only because of the operation of this section.

subsection.leadIn: The—

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: employment may be terminated; or

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: terms and conditions of the employment may be varied,

subsection.continued: on or after the transition date in the same manner and to the same extent as immediately before that date.

subsection.content: Nothing in this Ordinance affects the validity of anything done by, on behalf of or in relation to the transferor before the transition date.

If anything is in the process of being done by, on behalf of or in relation to the transferor immediately before the transition date, it may be carried on or completed by, on behalf of or in relation to the transferee.

Civil proceedings commenced by or against the school or the transferor before the transition date may be continued or enforced on or after that date by or against the transferee as if the transferee was a party to the proceedings.
All claims and defences that were available to the school or the transferor are available to the transferee.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to Article 11(2)(g) of the Hong Kong Bill of Rights set out in the Hong Kong Bill of Rights Ordinance (Cap. 383), books and other documents which would, before the transition date, have been evidence in respect of any matter for or against any one or more of the following parties, are admissible in evidence in respect of the same matter for or against the transferee—

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: the school;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: any person in his capacity as the supervisor or a manager or former manager of the school; or

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: the transferor.

subsection.def: In this section, documents (文件) has the same meaning as in section 46 of the Evidence Ordinance (Cap. 8).

subsection.content: This section applies to any agreement, arrangement or contract made or entered into or transaction effected by, on behalf of or in relation to the transferor before the transition date.

If an agreement, arrangement, contract or transaction to which this section applies is in force or effective immediately before the transition date or it is to take effect on or after that date, it shall have effect as from that date as if it were made, entered into or effected by, on behalf of or in relation to the transferee.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Record of property
section.content: The record of property of the transferor, which is in the form of an entry in the books of a bank, company or other corporation immediately before the transition date, shall be transferred in those books by the bank, company or corporation to the transferee upon the transferee’s request.

subsection.content: On the transition date, the transferee becomes the owner of all books, accounts, receipts or other document (however compiled, recorded or stored) relating to the management of the school in the control or possession of the transferor.

All such books, accounts, receipts or other document shall be delivered to the transferee immediately after that date by the person who has the care and custody of them otherwise than pursuant to a lawful authority.
Any person who contravenes subsection (2) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 3 months. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2014)
